loans.name: Teofe Idioneta

texts.en: Teofe Idioneta is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Teofe Idioneta has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for 8 years. She has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Teofe Idioneta has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Teofe Idioneta hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Rev Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 53 years old. She is married to Daniel, and together they have two children. She is a farmer and has been in the business for the past eight years.

This is her second term loan with KADET. She paid her previous loan well and in good time. She was introduced to us by one of our field officers. She will use the loan amount to purchase seedlings and fertilizer and also to pay her laborers.

She hopes to be a large-scale farmer.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer and also to pay her laborers.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 40-year-old businessman who is married to Susan. They are blessed with eight children. He has been a tailor for the past seven years with a monthly income of KES 15,000 which he uses to support his family.

Paul is applying for his fifth loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. He will use the loan to buy clothing materials for his tailoring business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, Paul will support his children's education. His hopes and dreams are to open a boutique shop that will help him improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy clothing materials for his tailoring business.

loans.name: Harun

texts.en:
Harun is 34 years old. He is married to Evelyne, who is a green grocer, and together they have two children. He is a tailor who deals in school uniforms. He has been in this business for the past two years.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD. He was introduced to KADET by a friend who is a client. He will use the loan to purchase clothing materials and threads for use in his business.

He hopes to be a well-known school uniform dealer, which will earn him business from the schools.

loans.use: To purchase clothing materials and threads

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. In their village, Jocelyn is selling food such as fried chicken and kare-kare – a traditional Filipino dish. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for making food, such as meat, dressed chicken, and spices. Jocelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to improve her business to better provide for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making food.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en: Josie is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. Josie has a food and retail shop, or sari-sari store, that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for seven years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Josie has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single and has one child.

Elvira has a store that sells fruits like bananas and oranges and some root crops. She has had this business for seven years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more fruits to sell.

Elvira has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of fruits to sell

loans.name: Evan

texts.en:
Evan is 46 years old. He is married to Florence and together they have three children. Evan is a farmer and has been in the business for the past five years.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD. He was introduced to KADET by credit officers. Evan will use the loan to purchase animal feed for his cows. He hopes to be a well-known farmer in his area.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed.

loans.name: Egidie

texts.en: Egidie is 40 years old. She sells tomatoes and bananas. She has been in this business for the past six years. With this loan, she will add more tomatoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for her family.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes to resell.

loans.name: Adjeniya Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ADJENIYA est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Latifatou est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Latifatou est âgée de 28 ans et vit au Bénin. Latifatou n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Latifatou est mariée à un certain Waïbi. Le couple a deux enfants dont un scolarisé et tous à leur charge. Latifatou vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec  son mari les charges de la maison. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Latifatou vend depuis cinq ans, des produits cosmétiques (poudre, coton) de façon ambulante. Latifatou s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Latifatou sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ADJENIYA, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur permettra certainement à hausser le niveau de leurs activités et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en: The ADJENIYA group is made up of three people who all live in the same neighborhood. This is the first time that the group has asked for  financial aid from Alidé, in order to increase their level of activity. The group's representative, Latifatou, has her hand raised in the photo. Latifou is 28 years old and lives in Benin. She did not go to school. Latifou is married to Waïbi. The couple have two children, one of whom goes to school. Both children are in their care. Latifou lives together with her husband and children. She and her husband both pay for the household's expenses. In order to meet her family's expenses, for the last five years Latifou has been selling cosmetic products (powder, cotton) on foot. She obtains her supplies from a town in Benin. In order to meet customer demand and increase turnover and income, Latifou, along with the other members of the ADJENIYA group, is asking for a first loan from ALIDé. This loan will allow them to increase the level of their activities and make more profit.

loans.use: to buy powder and cotton.

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is a 44-year-old married man and father of three children. He has worked as an electrician for fifteen years. In 2010, he opened a new store where he sells electronics to increase his income and provide for his family.

Jihad applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to purchase the cables and spare parts necessary in his shop and in his business as an electrician. He takes several projects and enjoys expanding his working region.

This is Jihad's first cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower.  With great excitement, he is planning for the future and wants to expand his working sector a lot. Jihad works hard to provide his family the best living ever. He is trying his best and hopes that they will get all that they aim to have.

loans.use: To purchase necessary cables and spare parts

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is a 33-year-old business lady. She is married to Michael, who is a businessman. They are blessed with two children. She has been running a beauty salon as a primary business and selling new clothes as a secondary business for the past three years. She earns a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced to them by an existing KADET customer. Hannah will use the loan to buy a blow dryer and more new clothes. 

With the anticipated profit from the two businesses, she will educate her children. Her hope is to add cosmetics to her beauty salon and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To buy a blow dryer and more new clothes

loans.name: Djidjohognon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DJIDJOHOGNON est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la neuvième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Pascaline est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Pascaline est âgée de 52 ans et vit au Bénin. Pascaline n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pascaline est une veuve et mère de trois enfants dont aucun n’est scolarisé. Parmi les enfants, il ne reste qu’un enfant à charge. Pascaline vit seule et assure seule ses diverses charges et ceux de son enfant. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges et ceux de son enfant, Pascaline vend des ustensiles et des plastiques dans un marché du Bénin. Pascaline s’approvisionne dans sa région et dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Pascaline sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DJIDJOHOGNON, un neuvième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur permettra certainement à hausser le niveau de leurs activités et à se faire plus de profits. Les huit premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The  DJIDJOHOGNON group is made up of three people who all live in the same neighborhood. This is the ninth time that the group has asked for  financial aid from Alidé, in order to increase their level of activity. The group's representative, Pascaline, has her hand raised in the photo. Pascaline is 52 years old and lives in Benin. She did not go to school. Pascaline is a widow and has three children, none of whom has been to school. Only one of the children is still in her care. Pascaline lives alone, and takes care of her needs and those of her child on her own. In order to meet their expenses, Pascaline sells utensils and plastic items in a market in Benin. She obtains her supplies locally and in a town in Benin. In order to meet customer demand and increase turnover and income, Pascaline, along with the other members of the DJIDJOHOGNON group, is asking for a first loan from ALIDé. This loan will allow them to increase the level of their activities and make more profit. The first eight loans have been fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy plastic items.

loans.name: Khishigjargal

texts.en:
Khishigjargal, aged 31, has worked in a medical center as a janitress for the past six years. Her husband works as an adjuster in a furniture manufacturing company in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He operates a taxi every day after his job in order to earn extra income for his family. Their combined salaries do not meet their family's needs. 

Khishigjargal lives with her husband and their two children in the ger district, an area of the city with no running water, minimal roads, erratic electricity and which includes the Mongolian traditional nomadic yurts, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Last June, Khishigjargal's family moved in Ulaanbaatar and bought a small land plot and a house in which they are now living.  

The new dwelling has so many things that should be repaired or renovated. Firstly, the house has heat loss through its inside walls, floor, ceiling, windows and door. So, Khishigjargal needs to install wall insulation with foam boards and cement, and replace the windows and door. Then she will repair her floor and ceiling. As she believes her home will be totally warm and comfortable after the repairs, she will not need to use coal to warm her home. Also Khishigjargal knows that it is important to reduce the harm to her family's health and through environmental pollution from the smoke. Her requested loan will be dedicated to covering the costs of building materials needed for her home repairs and wall insulation.

loans.use: To buy building materials needed for her home repairs and wall insulation.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy would like to take out a further loan to buy new furniture and better quality meat to sell from her stall. Thuy's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and to earn a higher income to support her family. 

Thuy hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy new furniture and better quality meat to sell from her stall

loans.name: Nargel

texts.en:
Nargel is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Nargel has a food/retail shop (a sari-sari store) that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for six years. 

Nargel has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Nargel hopes to improve her business to support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Alexius

texts.en:
Alexius, age 40, is married to Jumiati, age 30. They are blessed with four children: Marselinus, 12 years old and attending 6th grade, Jeskiel, 7 years old and attending 3rd grade, Sefira, 6 years old and attending 2nd grade, and Asael, 4 years old.

Alexius has been a fishmonger since 2008. He used to run a motor taxi business, but the income it generated was unstable. Thus, he decided to be a fishmonger to better cover his family’s needs.

Alexius is planning to purchase more fish such as tuna, snapper, and red stripe rock fish to meet his customers’ demand. Therefore, Alexius is seeking a loan of 4,000,000 IDR from TLM to buy fish in large quantities.

loans.use: to buy fish in large quantities.

loans.name: Khary

texts.fr:
Mme khary habite à 70 km de la capitale, mariée et mère de famille, elle évolue dans la friperie depuis plus de 20 ans, elle vend au marché, dans les marchés hebdomadaires et à la maison.
Mme Khary sollicite un prêt de 100 000 pour augmenter la quantité achetée de friperie afin de réaliser plus de bénéfices pour pouvoir épargner et satisfaire ses besoins. Elle projette d’avoir un jour  la possibilité de voyager à travers le monde rien que pour faire le commerce en amenant des conteneurs  de friperie.
texts.en:
Ms. Khary lives 70 km from the capital. She is married and the mother of a family. She has been working in secondhand clothing for over twenty years. She sells at the market, at weekly markets, and at the house. 

Ms. Khary is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs to increase the amount of secondhand clothing purchased in order to make more profit, so as to save money and meet her needs. She plans on being able to travel around the world one day for nothing but business in order to bring back containers of used clothing.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothing to make more income for coping with the high cost of living

loans.name: Alimatou

texts.fr: Mme Alimatou habite à 70 km de la capitale, mariée et mère de famille s’active dans le commerce depuis plus de 3 ans. Elle gère une cantine qu’elle a ouverte depuis quelques années et elle y vend des tissus, elle achetait ses marchandises à sandaga marché qui se trouve dans la capitale  mais maintenant elle veut essayer  une nouvelle destination qu’est la Gambie et pour cela elle  sollicite un crédit de 300 000 pour acheter des tissus. Mme Alimatou veut un jour faire partie des commerçants les plus riches de sa ville.
texts.en:
Ms. Alimatou lives 70 km from the capital. She is married and the mother of a family and has been active in commerce for over three years. She manages a stall that she opened a few years ago. There, she sell cloth. 

She used to buy her merchandise at the Sandaga market, which is located in the capital, but now she wants to try a new destination, namely Gambia. To do so, she is requesting a loan of 300,000 to buy some fabrics. Ms. Alimatou wants join the ranks of the wealthest merchants in her city one day.

loans.use: to buy fabrics in Gambia to make more profit for meeting her needs

loans.name: Placida

texts.es:
La señora Placida tiene 46 años de edad, es casada y fruto de esta relación tiene seis hijos, ella nació y vive en la ciudad de Oropesa a 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. Su actividad económica  de la socia es la elaboración de pan  de “oropesa”. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. 

La señora Placida es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que le invitaron a participar del banco Comunal “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” de la Asociación Arariwa. En esta oportunidad la señora Placida requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del horno. 

La señora Placida agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Placida is 46 years old, is married and has six children as a result of this relationship.  She was born and lives in the town of Oropesa, 30 minutes from the city of Cusco.  Her economic activity as a member (of the communal bank) is the making of “Oropesa” bread (a traditionally-made, well-known bread from this town).  She has already made a living for many years at this business and it is going well for her.

Placida is an enterprising and hardworking woman who was invited to take part in the communal bank “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” of the “Asociación Arariwa”. On this occasion Placida requests the loan to do maintenance on her oven.

Placida is grateful for the loan and promises to comply with the payment of her installments according to the schedule of payments.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her oven.

loans.name: Irish

texts.en: Irish is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Irish has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store where she  buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for six years. Aside from that, she also has a motorcycle service. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. Irish has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Irish hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Issa

texts.fr: Mr Issa habite à quelques kilomètres de la capitale, marié et père de famille il a très tôt su se démarqué et prendre son avenir en main, dès  l’âge de 13 ans il obtient sa première cantine au marché grand Thiès situé tout prés de chez lui où il vend des produits cosmétiques .Mr Issa a bénéficié de 3 prêts  et a respecté tous les engagements vis-à-vis de l’Institution. Cette fois IL sollicite   un crédit de 400 000 pour acheter des produits cosmétiques  afin de générer plus de bénéfices qui lui permettront de subvenir à ses besoins et d’améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille. Mr Issa veut un jour avoir une autonomie financière  et être un très grand grossiste.
texts.en:
Mr. Issa lives a few kilometers from the capital. He is married and the father of family. Early on, he found out how distinguish himself and grab hold of his future. As early as the age of 13, he had his first stall at the big Thiès market, located very near his home where he sells cosmetic products. 

Mr. Issa has benefited from three loans and has respected all the commitments with regard to the institution. This time, he is requesting a loan of 400,000 francs to buying some cosmetics to generate more profit, enabling him to support himself and to improve his family's food situation. Mr. Issa wants to be financially autonomous one day and to be a very big wholesale merchant.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to make more profit for supporting himself and his family

loans.name: Jecinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is 39 years old. She has been running a cereals business for the last 12 years, earning a monthly income of KES 9,750

She has applied for her second loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD, which she plan to use to purchase more stock of maize, beans and peas. 

She will invest the anticipated profits back into her business. Her future dream is to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of maize, beans and peas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Faiza

texts.en:
Faiza has always been a hard-working, enthusiastic person who  together with her husband, has dedicated all her hard work to provide for her family. 

On her own initiative and thanks to support from her family, Faiza has been doing well in her business. She says that the previous loan helped her to increase her monthly income. Her dream is to open a larger spare parts shop. Thanks to her effots, she is now requesting a loan of KSHS 80,000 to purchase iron sheets and other building materials to renovate her residential house.

loans.use: to purchase iron sheets and other building materials

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La señora Ana tiene 43 años de edad, es casada y fruto de esta relación tiene tres hijos, ella nació y vive en la ciudad de Oropesa a 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. La socia trabaja en una entidad pública pero en sus horas libres se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. 

La señora Ana es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que le invitaron a participar del banco Comunal “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” de la Asociación Arariwa. En esta oportunidad la señora Ana requiere el préstamo para comprar animales menores como cuyes y gallinas y también va comprar alimento para los animales. 

La señora Ana agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Ana, 43, is married and has three children from that relationship. She was born and lives in the city of Oropesa, 30 minutes from the city of Cusco. She works for a public entity, but in her free time she raises small animals like guinea pigs and hens. She has been doing this for some years and it's going well.

Ana is an entrepreneurial and hardworking woman who was invited to join the village bank "Virgen Asunta de Oropesa", part of the Arariwa Association. On this occasion Ana needs a loan to buy small animals like guinea pigs and hens and also to buy food for the animals.

Ana is grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy small animals like guinea pigs and hens, as well as to buy food for them.

loans.name: Luisa Lucrecia

texts.es: Luisa tiene 41 años de edad y su familia está formada por ella su esposo y 04 hijos de los cuales 03 de ellos en etapa escolar. Luisa trabaja como cobradora de bus hace más de 10 años. Al ver que los ingresos de su pareja no eran suficientes Lucia decide apoyar. Ella es una madre emprendedora que su esfuerzo y trabajo ha podido cumplir algunos de sus sueños, como hacerse acreedora de un terreno la cual está pagando sus últimas cuotas y también mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Su siguiente meta es de construir su vivienda y ver a sus hijos profesionales. En esta oportunidad solicito el crédito para los gastos de promoción de su hijo ya que esta por terminar su 5to año. Luisa agradece a todas las personas que hicieron posible este crédito.
texts.en:
Luisa is 41 and her family is composed of her husband and four children, three of whom are in school. Luisa has worked as a fare collector on a bus for more than 10 years. When she saw that her husband's income wasn't sufficient, Luisa decided to support him. She is an entrepreneurial mother whose hard work and effort have helped her to achieve some of her dreams, like helping her to secure a mortgage on a piece of land which she is almost done paying off, and also improving her family's quality of life. Her next goal is to build a home and to see her children become professionals. 

On this occasion she asked for a loan to pay for her son's annual schooling costs as he is about to finish his 5th year. Luisa is grateful to the people who made this loan possible.

loans.use: to pay for schooling.

loans.name: Melvin Vladimir

texts.es:
Melvin, administra una tienda y la venta de pollo empanizado, vive con su madre y un hermano, está soltero y no tiene hijos, su hermano es el que depende de él, su negocio lo inició hace un año y lo aprendió en su casa, trabaja desde las siete de la mañana hasta las siete de la noche, su ventaja es que el negocio está en un lugar céntrico donde puede tener un buen número de clientes, hasta el momento no ha tenido ninguna dificultad.

Solicita un préstamo para realizar la compra de insumos para la tienda como productos de aseo personal, papel higiénico, detergentes, también alimentos como arroz, frijoles, aceite, boquitas, también se comprara pollo, este préstamo le servirá para incrementar el inventario y así continuar con sus ventas.

La aspiración de él es conocer de una manera amplia el negocio, tiner muchos clientes ser reconocido, ya que esto le permitirá crecer y lograr una mejor estabilidad de vida.
texts.en:
Melvin runs a store and sells breaded chicken. He lives with his mother and a brother. He is single and does not have children, but his brother is dependent on him. He started his business a year ago and learned it at home. He works from 7:00am until 7:00pm. His advantage is that his business is centrally-located, so he has a good number of customers. Up to now he hasn't had any difficulties. 

He asks for a loan to buy inputs for the store like personal hygiene products, toilet paper and detergents, as well as food like rice, beans, oil, snacks. He will also buy chicken. This loan will help him to increase his inventory and continue his sales.

His dream is to figure out how to increase his business, have many customers and be recognized, since this will allow him to grow and achieve more stability in life.

loans.use: to buy personal hygiene products, toilet paper, detergent, rice, beans.

loans.name: Yosep

texts.en:
Yosep, 33 years old, is married to Regina, a 33 year old woman. They have been blessed with 3 sons: Even, 8 years old, is attending the first grade of elementary school; Feri, 5 years old, is attending the first grade of elementary school, and Andri, 3 years old.

To make a living, Yosep sells various vegetables such as water spinach, squash, mustard greens, carrots, etc. at a traditional market. He started his vegetable business using the limited capital that he had. 

Yosep recognized that the vegetable business does not always run well. He wishes to improve his business by selling other products such as tomatoes, chilies and other cooking spices in order to generate a better income. To do so, Yosep is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 4,500,000 from TLM to purchase new stocks to be sold.

loans.use: to purchase new stock to be sold.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a 47-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She is the owner of a clothing shop where she sells women's and children's clothes. She is well known in her region, for her good reputation and the special customer service that she provides. Most of her clients are relatives, friends and neighbors. She's a hard worker and seeks perfection to provide her family with the necessary living needs.

Khadija is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the forth time, in order to increase her summer collection. This will reflect positively on her business development, especially that this summer the designs are very attractive to her customers, as she claims. Her previous loans were invested in improving her business and they had a big positive effect on improving her income. She is still planning to buy her own shop and move to a better region in the future.

loans.use: to increase her summer clothing collection.

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael is 33 years old and married to Mary. They are blessed with one child. He has been running a spare parts shop for the past ten years. He earns a monthly income of KES 20,000, which he uses to support his family.

Raphael is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loan successfully. Raphael will use the loan to buy spare parts to add to his business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his child. His hopes and dreams are to buy a pickup and use it for transportation

loans.use: to buy spare parts to add to his business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 

Evelyn is selling RTW's, or ready to wear products, like blouses, t-shirts and pants. She has had this business for 8 years. She has requested a loan for 4,000 to buy more RTW's to re sell.

Evelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Evelyn hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of RTW clothing to re sell.

loans.name: Noflina

texts.en:
Noflina is a 49 year old married lady. She has three daughters: Desi, 29, married; Enggelina, 18; and Kristin, 10, is attending grade 4 at elementary school. 

Three years ago, Noflina was able to buy a “bemo”- minivan that is used as a public transportation. The business helps her in generating income for her family. At the moment, Noflina cannot produce any income from the minivan as it is broken and has to be repaired. Therefore, Noflina has requested a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 8,000,000. Noflina really hopes that the loan assistance will help her in covering the entire cost of repairing the van.

loans.use: to cover the whole vehicle repair costs.

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en:
Rahab is 32 years old, from Nakuru, and is married. Her children are aged between five and 12 years old.

Rahab has a restaurant which she has been operating for the past three years. She has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD., to enable her to buy wheat flour, maize, beans, etc.

She hopes to open a big hotel in town and be able to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, maize, beans.

loans.name: Evelyne

texts.en: Evelyne turns 28 years old this month. She has three children. She is married to a businessman. With the loan, she wants to add more T-shirts to sell since she has been doing this business for the past four years. The profits from the business will be used for providing food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more T-shirts to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy piglets, chicks and fodder

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 31 year old woman who is married to Yohanes, a 40 year old man. They have 3 children and all of them are attending Elementary school: Yosua and Yermia, 11 years old, are twins; Naherson, 5 years old.

Due to the small income that her husband earns, Maria took an initiative to commence a kiosk business. She works hard in running the business and after one year she was able to run another business, which is pig breeding. She usually purchases piglets from her customer, to be fattened for 6 months before reselling. 

At the moment, Maria would like to purchase 4 more piglets but she only has small capital to do so. Therefore, she is requesting a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 4,800,000.

loans.use: to purchase 4 more piglets to be fattened and resold.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is 43 years old, married to Mercy and blessed with three children. He is an electrician and also in the business of car hiring. He started these businesses nine years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 28,000. 

Eric has requested for a second loan of KES. 50,000 to purchase chicks for rearing, as a new line of business that will be managed by his wife. The profit he makes will aid him in expanding this business. 

His dream is of being an ardent white meat producer.

loans.use: to purchase chicks, for rearing, as a new line of business.

loans.name: Israel

texts.es:
Israel, vive con su esposa, no tiene hijos, el administra un ciber, estudió para electricista Pero luego conoció mucho de lo que es la computación y se decidió a instalar el negocio de las computadoras y tiene cinco años existir, prestando los servicios de esta digitacion de trabajos y de Internet.

Solicita un préstamo para comprarse los útiles necesarios como papel,cd y dvd, tintas, folder, algunos muebles y también monitores, con esto mejorará el servicio para la producción de trabajos impresos, también los que son gravables, así poder ofrecer a sus clientes.

Su objetivo es mejorar las instalaciones del local, mejorar el mobiliario, las computadoras, logrando obtener un ciber mas competente, que le permita mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Israel lives with his wife. They don’t have children. He has a cybercafé. He studied to be an electrician, but later he learned a lot about computers and decided to start his computer business, which he’s now had for five years. He provides document typing and formatting services and also internet access. 

He is requesting a loan to buy necessary supplies such as paper, CDs, DVDs, inks, folders, some furniture items, and also monitors. With these things he will be able to improve his services for producing print jobs, and he will also be able to record things [on CD or DVD] for his clients. 

His goal is to improve his store and improve the furniture and the computers, so that he can have a more professional cybercafé, which will improve his income.

loans.use: to buy paper, CDs, DVDs, inks, and folders

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children. 

Angeles provides a grater machine in their local community market, aside from that she also sells green bananas. She has had this business for 7 years. She has requested a loan for 5,000PHP to buy tools for the maintenance of the grating machine.

Angeles has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future,Angeles hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools for the maintenance of the grater machine.

loans.name: Algen

texts.en:
Algen is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Algen has a shop that sells candies, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to buy snacks, beverages and candies.

Algen has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Algen hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages and candies

loans.name: Mrina

texts.en: Mrina's wife has a new baby of six months. They say that this second child has increased their joy in marriage. Mrina continues with his charcoal selling business. He is a very focused man who looks for new opportunities every moment. He says that the previous loan helped him to save a good amount and that he is planning to open a grocery stall for his wife. Mrina has turned to Yehu for another loan to diversify his areas of operation. With this loan, he plans to purchase a motorcycle to offer transport services, hence increasing his income. This way he will be able to provide for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is twenty eight years old, married and has two children. He has operated a restaurant business for the last two years, earning monthly income of KES 20,000. He has applied for his first loan, from KADET LTD, which he plans to use in purchasing more stock of food stuffs, such as meat, flour, and sugar to meet the demands of his client.

The anticipated profits will be invested back into his business. Alex's future dreams are to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of food stuffs, such as meat, flour, and sugar.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 51-year-old married man, father of four children. He has been working as a butcher for thirty years and is still planning to expand his business more and more.

Mohamad takes good care of his family members and makes sure that they get almost all of what they need. Mohamad is a hard worker, who seeks perfection in his business to keep his customers pleased. He has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to increase his meat stock, especially for Ramadan month. Most of the people during the month of Ramadan send meat portions to charities to stay next to those who are in need. Mohamad has to be ready all the time for any additional requests.

Mohamad will also use part of the loan to help his handicapped daughter, as he states.

loans.use: to increase his meat stock, especially for Ramadan month.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David used his previous loan amount to buy more stock of goods to sell in his retail shop. It was profitable and he was able to pay the loan amount well and on good time.

He plans to use this loan amount to buy farm inputs, such as fertilizer and seeds for planting. He also plans to buy a dairy cow. With the anticipated profits, he plans to pay school fees for his children as well as to improve the living standards of his family.

In the future, David hopes to invest more in dairy farming.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Ny is a 37-year-old married woman who is responsible for two sons, both of whom are dependent on her and still enrolled in school. 

Ny and her husband struggle to feed their children in the rural area of Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, where rice farming is the source of her family’s income on a 0.5-hectare area of farmland. They supplement the family income by planting cassava on a two-hectare piece of farmland. They have been in this business for several years to make their living. Together, they are able to earn 27,800 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

This is Ny’s fifth loan cycle with VisionFund and she definitely repaid the past loans. She has used the past loans to relieve family’s burdens and to improve the family's livelihood. Now she is asking for a loan of 2,500,000 KHR from VisionFund. Ny will use this loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to pay for labor costs and land plowing. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from the current business so as to fulfill her dream to have a decent car for the family to use in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Petronila is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 1 child. 

Petronila is selling green bananas in their village. Aside from that she is also selling snacks. She has had this business for 22 years. She has requested a loan for 4,000 PHP to buy green bananas to re sell.

Petronila has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Petronila hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy green bananas to re sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy various goods such as: lotions, sugar, soap, rice, cooking oil etc. for resale.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 50 years old and she is living in the Philippines. She is married and has 1 child.

Gloria is involved in buying and selling food products in her sari sari store. Gloria also has a peddling business: she cooks snacks and viands to peddle around the village. Gloria is requesting a loan amounting to 8000PHP to buy more goods to sell and, at same time, additional capital to buy raw ingredients  for her peddling business. 

Gloria has had the business for more than 3 years now. She joins HSPFI this year, 2012. In the future, Gloria is hoping to improve her business and to earn more income so she can provide for the needs of her family and her child.

loans.use: to buy more food stocks like bread, biscuits, noodles, milk, chocolate drinks and more to sell.

loans.name: Sylvie

texts.en:
Sylvie is 37 years old. She has switched from selling sorghum to selling soaps, salt and sugar. She has been in the business six months. With the loan, she will buy more items to sell. With the profits from this business, she will pay school fees for the children. 

Sylvie is a very dedicated mom, and happy for the previous loan, which she says helped her business to grow through getting enough capital to start a new business.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 33 years old, from Nakuru and he is married. He has two children who are aged between two years and four years old.

Peter has a motorcycle business that he has been doing for the past four years. He has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD. to enable him to service his motorcycle.

Peter hopes to buy a piece of land in the near future.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single and has no children but she owns a mini-grocery store that displays and sells a variety of goods like canned goods, snacks, coffee, milk and more. She has a lot of customers in their village. Marina is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to sustain and buy more products to sell in order to have more income. She's had this business for more than five years. Marina joined HSPFI just this year, 2012. In the future, Marina is looking forward to improving her business so that she can earn more income and have the chance to sustain her business.

loans.use: To buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, snacks and drinks

loans.name: Ernestine

texts.en: Ernestine is 47 years old. She wants to use the loan to buy more skirts to sell. She has spent three years selling clothing. She has five children and all go to school. She plans to use the profits for paying school fees for the children.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mefide

texts.en:
Mefide lives in Kosovo. She is married. She has two boys; age 12 and 7 years old. Her boys both attend school. To earn a living, Mefide operates a tailoring and handicraft business from her home. She has been a tailor since 1997.

Mefide makes tablecloths, curtains skirts and traditional costumes and then her mother in law sells the items in the market. She has been sustaining her business through her own efforts. She is very professional and really enjoys her work, and she has many requirements from her customers. 

Mefide is requesting a loan through KosInvest to buy a new sewing machine. She hopes to earn a higher income and to expand her business in the future.
Mefide's goal is to improve the living conditions of her family and to save money to use towards her children's education.

Mefide really appreciates this support.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Robilyn

texts.en:
Robilyn is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 

Robilyn is providing motorela, or motorcycle services, as her husband is the driver. Aside from that, she is also selling RTW's. She has had this business for 4 years. She has requested a loan for 4,000PHP to buy tools & to pay for the gasoline for the services.

Robilyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Robilyn hopes to improve her services.

loans.use: to buy tools and to pay for the gasoline.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz vive en un municipio muy cercano a la ciudad con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 6 y 10 años. Ella en un punto comercial  ubicado en su vivienda,  tiene un café internet y ofrece servicios de video-juegos, internet, además de vender papelería dulces y refrescos. Este negocio nació en el año 2006, cuando  su esposo quedó sin empleo en una empresa importante de la ciudad y recibió la ayuda de varias personas de manera solidaria: su amigo quien había cerrado su propio café internet le facilitó dos televisores y un play station, también un familiar compró dos televisores a créditos  y con esta estructura empezó a trabajar. Su clientela cada día fue aumentando y así mismo Luz fue agregando dulces y refrescos pues una empresa importante le suministró un enfriador. Poco a poco su negocio fue despegando y pasaron cosas buenas en su hogar, su esposo aprovechó su experiencia en el conocimiento de medicinas y emprendió su propio negocio de droguería  en otro punto del municipio. En la actualidad Luz cuenta con 5 computadores, 12 televisores 6 X-box 5 play y una vitrina, además de una clientela fija producto de su buen servicio y que está ubicada en un punto estratégico para este mercado. Su meta mas adelante  es ampliar su negocio, construyendo un segundo piso, para dividir su espacio familiar del productivo y por eso trabaja sin descanso de lunes a domingo. Así mismo su gran motor de impulso,  son sus 2 hijos en las edades de 6 y 10 años, a quienes quiere ver convertidos en personas exitosas y con mucho bienestar. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará papelería dulces, refrescos, y hará mantenimiento a sus equipos, para seguir siendo muy efectiva en su negocio, con el fin de que sus clientela siga fiel y la acompañe en el cumplimento de sus metas.
texts.en: Luz lives in a town very near the city with her husband and their two children, who are 6 and 10 years old. She has an internet café in her home and offers video games and internet services and also sells stationary items, sweets, and soft drinks. She started this business in 2006, when her husband was let go from a job at an important business in the city. She received help from many people who were supportive of her. A friend, who had closed his own internet café, helped her out with two televisions and a Playstation. Also, a family member bought two televisions on credit, and with this equipment, she began her business. Her customer base grew every day, and Luz added sweets and soft drinks when an important business provided her with a refrigerator. Little by little, her business grew and good things happened in her home. Her husband took advantage of his knowledge of medicines and opened up his own pharmacy business in another part of town. Luz now has 5 computers, 12 televisions, 6 X-Boxes, 5 Playstations, and a vitrine. She also has a good client base, due to her good customer service and her strategic location. Her goal for the future is to expand her business by building a second floor, so she can separate her family’s space from her business space. In order to achieve this, she works without rest, from Monday through Sunday. Her greatest motivation is her 2 children, who are 6 and 10 years old, and whom she wants to see become successful and have a good life. She is currently requesting a loan, which she will use to buy stationary items, sweets, and soft drinks. She will also use it to do some maintenance on her equipment, so that she can continue to have a successful business that her customers will be loyal to and help her achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy stationary items, sweets, and soft drinks and also to do some maintenance on her equipment

loans.name: Yorn's Group

texts.en:
Yorn is 38 years old and a widowed mother living in Sampov Meas district of Pursat District. She has three children under her care, some of whom are still at school while the remaining is helping the family's business. 

To strive for a living, Yorn has been growing paddy rice on two hectares of farmland as the primary source of income. In addition to better feed her family as the single mother, Yorn also grows corns, cucumbers, and cabbages. For the several years that she has been with these businesses, she earns about 12,000 KHR per day. Her main challenges are the fruitless cash-crops caused by the drought and the insects. 

This is the first loan cycle for Yorn with VisionFund. She joins a group of four female members to seek for a new loan in order to overcome her challenges. One of her group members is also a newly joined client, another one is a third cycled client, and the remaining one is a second cycled client. Yorn and the other three group members are applying for 1,000,000 KHR each. 

As the group leader, Yorn will use her loan portion to buy 5 sacks of fertilizer for her rice field. Moreover, she will use a portion of it to buy 10 chickens and one piglet for raising to earn more income. She hopes to receive more crop yields and to raise her chickens and pig healthfully so that she can earn more income. By doing so, she can save some money to buy a motorbike to support her business.

loans.use: to buy 5 sacks of fertilizer,10 chickens, and one pig.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and to pay for the gasoline.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 25 years of age, single, with one child. She owns a retail shop and has been in operation for one year now. The business brings in a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

This is Caroline’s first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD. She will use the loan to purchase sugar, tea leaves and bundles of maize flour for resale. With the anticipated profits, she plans to pay her child's school fees and the remaining amount will be used on running the business. Her dream and hopes is to live a comfortable life.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, tea leaves and bundles of maize flour for resale.

loans.name: Clemence

texts.en: Clemence is 32 years old. She sells cooking oil and sugar. She has been doing this business for two years. With the loan she has requested, she will buy more cooking oil and make savings from the profits. She says that the previous loan helped her to increase the stock of sales and solve the problems with the family.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
A responsible married mother of an only son, who is under her care and still attending school, Sophal is 29 years old. She lives in the rural area of the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To make a living, she has been in rice farming and devotes her spare time to raising and selling fishes to generate more income. Having been in this business for almost ten years, she is able to earn about USD11 per day to satisfy her family’s needs. However, drought that has ruined her crop yield and the low price of fishes are the main challenges for her business.

This is the second loan cycle for Sophal with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. The first loan has helped her in augmenting her business activities, and improving her living conditions. Now she is requesting for a loan with VisionFund of USD1,100 to purchase fish feed, and more fries for raising. She will also use a portion of it to dig a pond in order to expand her fish business. She hopes this loan will enable her current business to be more productive and profitable so as to make more income to earn a good living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To purchase fish feed and more fries for raising.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more food to sell like bread, biscuits, canned goods, pasta and more.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 

Margie is selling snacks like biscuits and chocolates. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for 5,000PHP to buy snacks to re sell.

Margie has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Margie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase snacks to re sell.

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en: Valentine is aged 30. She has four children between three and twelve years of age. She has requested the loan to buy more soap, and cooking oil to sell. She has been running this business for the past two years. With the profits from the business, she will renovate the house.

loans.use: to buy more soaps and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Nzara

texts.en:
Fatuma is 52 years old and she lives with her life partner and six children in her own house. She sells fish from her home. She has been in this line of business for ten years and it has given her good results. 

Fatuma's business is located in a strategic place and she has many customers, as everybody prefers her because her fish is the best. She sells the fish at good prices and, above all, she provides the best service. Nzara is a resourceful woman with a great desire to progress in life. She wants to reach success and she will fight hard to achieve it, even as she aims to open a a retail shop in future. 

Recently there has been an increase in her customer's requests and she needs to invest but she does not have enough money. She is requesting a loan of KES 40,000 to buy more stock of fish and cooking oil. Nzara is very responsible and she has good credit references. She is sure she will repay her loan and that she will provide her family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish and cooking oil.

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr:
Mr Abdoulaye âgé de 25 ans, marié et  père d’un enfant est maçon de profession. Voulant toujours subvenir  aux besoins de la famille il a ouvert un salon de coiffure dans sa maison, il y vend en même temps des produits cosmétiques, il mène cette activité depuis 10 ans. Mr Abdoulaye sollicite un crédit  de 300 000 pour acheter des produits cosmétiques afin d’élargir son commerce. A l’aide des bénéfices qu’il aura, il pourra prendre en charge sa famille.
Mr Abdoulaye  veut un jour atteindre une autonomie  financiere.
texts.en:
Mr Abdoulaye is 25 years old, married and father to one child. He is a builder by profession. In order to be always able to provide for his family, he opened a hairdressing salon in his home, from which he also sells cosmetic products. He has been carrying out this activity for 10 years. Mr Abdoulaye is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs to buy cosmetics in order to expand his business. He will use the profits to take care of his family.
Mr Abdoulaye hopes to become financially independent one day.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Alogojesuton 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement ALOGOJESUTON 2 est composé de vingt et une personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Le représentant de ce groupement, du nom de Dorothé est celui ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite pour une première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Dorothé a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Dorothé est âgé de 42 ans et est marié à une revendeuse du nom de Mélanie. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Dorothé et sa femme vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les diverses de la famille. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de sa famille, Dorothé vend depuis onze ans, divers produits vivriers à son domicile et dans un marché du Bénin. Dorothé s'approvisionne dans un village du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle, Dorothé et les autres membres du groupement ALOGOJESUTON 2 sollicitent un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé. Leur ambition est d’accroître le niveau de leur activité.
texts.en: The "Alogojesuton 2" group comprises 21 people who live in the same area. The group leader, named Dorothé, is the one whose hand is raised in the photo. With the goal of raising the level of their businesses in order to better meet the demands of their customers, this group is seeking its first round of financial support from ALIDÉ. Dorothé ended his studies in primary school. He is 42 years old and married to a retailer named Mélanie. The couple have four children, all in school and in their care. Dorothé and his wife live together with their children and provide for the family together. To contribute to meeting his family's needs, Dorothé has sold various food items at his home and at a market in Benin for eleven years. He gets his supplies in a town in Benin. With the goal of strengthening their businesses and better satisfying their clientele, Dorothé and the other members of the "Alogojesuton 2" group are seeking their first loan with ALIDÉ. Their ambition is to raise the level of their business.

loans.use: To buy food products.

loans.name: Setina

texts.en:
Setina is married with two chidren. Setina, a 32-year-old plastic products and scarf seller, is living with her family at Adedekpo (Teshie). Setina has been selling plastic utensils for nine years now. She supplies to customers in Teshie and Nungua. She is on her 4th loan cycle with ID-Ghana and she able to repay previous loans successfully. 

She needs 500 Ghana cedis to enable her to buy more plastic products to sell.

loans.use: to buy more plastic products to sell.

loans.name: Nyogbo Baafe Group

texts.en:
"God is Able" is a group of three trading women who leave in the same community. 

They are into the sale of provisions, such as rice, cassava, beans, plantains, ladies tops, and skirts. Ramatu, 32, is married whereas Anita, 35, and Florence, 49, are single.

Anita sells provisions, such as cassava and plantains at her residence in Teshie. She buys her goods from “Agbogbloshie” in Accra, Ghana. She has been in this business for eight years and uses the profit for reinvestment and for housekeeping.

She is taking care of two children who are of school-going ages. This is their fourth loan cycle with ID-Ghana and she needs this loan to buy more provisions, cassava, and plantains.

They need 1,650 Ghana cedis to be able to buy goods.

loans.use: to buy more provisions, like cassava and plantain, so that she will be able to meet her customer's needs.

loans.name: Sophorn's Group

texts.en:
Sophorn is 48 years old and a married mother of three children, two of whom are dependent on her and are still in school in the local area of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To make a living, she and her husband have been involved in cassava and bean planting as the main source of the family’s income for 10 years. She can earn on average KHR 17,000 per day to meet her family's daily needs. However, the low price of cassavas still is the main challenge for her.

Sophorn’s group consists of two members, who have been with VisionFund for two cycles. She has completely paid the past loans back and has successfully used the loans to relieve the family’s burden and save for her children’s education. Now she and the other member are applying for a loan with VisionFund of KHR 1,400,000 each. Sophorn, who is the group leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from the current business in order to lift her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Ask God Group

texts.en:
This is a group of widows aged between 45 and 62 years old. They are eight in number and are into the sale of plantains, kenkey (maize paste), fish, firewood and provisions. They formed this association to lift widows out of hardship. Grace, Gladys and Adueley are on their 4th loan cycle whereas the rest are on their 1st loan cycle. Grace sells at the market and the rest sell at their residence. 

Grace is 45 years old and sells plantains at the market. She has a child who is 16 years old and a student. She lives with her child in the extended family house. She buys plantains from a larger market and sells at her smaller, local market. She needs this money to buy more plantains to sell to her customers. She uses part of the profit to pay her child's school fees and as capital for reinvestment.

This group needs 1,750 Ghana cedis to buy more stock for their businesses.

loans.use: to buy more plantains to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy work tools.

loans.name: Kabanyana

texts.en: Kabanyana is 33 years old and is married with three children. She purchases and sells bananas. She has been in this business for four years. She works from 7 a.m to 7 p.m five days a week. Kabanyana currently employs three people. Kabanyana has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more bananas for resale. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more bananas for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a complete computer set.

loans.name: Diamaguene Ngokaré Group

texts.fr: Le groupe "Diamaguene ngokaré" est composé de cinq femmes , toutes mariées.Elles mènent des activités d'agriculture notamment la culture de l'arachide.Elles exploitent ainsi un grand champs collectif.La vente de la production en fin de saison leur permet d'avoir des revenus et de subvenir à certains de leurs besoins.Le chef du groupe (en foulard blanc,au milieu avec la main levée) est mère de six enfants. Chaque année, elle renouvelle sa garde robe ainsi que celle de ses enfants avec les revenus tirés de la vente de la production du champs collectif du groupement.Afin de préparer la campagne agricole de cette année, le groupe sollicite un pret de 500 000f pour acheter des semences et de l'engrais.
texts.en:
The group Diamaguene Ngokaré consists of five women, all married. They are farmers whose main focus is groundnuts. They share a large field, which they operate as a group. The sale of the crops at the end of the season allows them to earn revenue that helps to support some of their needs. 

The head of the group (in the center, with her hand raised, wearing a white scarf) is a mother to six children. Each year, she is able to renew her wardrobe as well as that of her children with the income earned from the sale of the group’s crops. 

In order to prepare for the upcoming planting season, the group is seeking a loan of 500,000F to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and resell caftans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Maimouna

texts.fr:
Mme  Maimouna  s’est établie au nord du pays, elle s’active dans  le commerce, mariée et mère de 9 enfants  dont le plus âgé a 35 ans et le cadet 2 ans.
Elle évolue dans ce domaine depuis plus de 30 ans et c’est son mari qui lui a appris le métier. Mme  Maimouna  travaille du matin au soir de 8 h à 19 h en vendant de l’huile de palme et d’arachide, elle sollicite un prêt de 150 000, ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter une quantité suffisante d’huile de palme et d’arachide pour ensuite les revendre afin de voir ses revenus augmentés. Elle pourra épargner en même temps  rembourser le crédit. Mme  Maimouna veut un jour avoir sa propre boutique d’alimentation générale dans sa localité.
texts.en:
Mme  Maimouna  has settled in the north of the country and she is active in buying and selling goods. She is married and mother of nine children, of whom the oldest is 35 and the youngest two years old. 

She has been evolving in this business for over 30 years and it is her husband who taught her the trade. Mme  Maimouna works from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. selling palm oil and peanut oil. She is requesting a loan of 150,000 XOF. This loan will permit her to buy a sufficient quantity of palm oil and peanut oil to be resold so that she can see her income grow. She will be able to put aside savings as well as reimburse the loan. 

Mme  Maimouna would one day like to have her own grocery shop in her place of residence.

loans.use: to buy palm oil and peanut oil for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for a tailoring business.

loans.name: Theopiste

texts.en:
Theopiste is 51 years old and married with six children. Theopiste sells potatoes. She has two years of experience in this work, and she currently employs six people to help her. She works from from 6 a.m. to 4 p.m. every day of the week, except on Saturdays. 

Theopiste has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy large quantities of potatoes for resale. With any profits, she will be able to save money for her future and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy large quantities of potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Jesusihuhlonte Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JESUSIHUHLONTE est composé de quatre personnes qui sont des amies résidant dans le même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Sabine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Sabine est âgée de 34 ans et vit au Bénin. Sabine est mariée à un pêcheur du nom de Germain. Le couple a cinq enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Sabine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari, les divers besoins du ménage. Afin de subvenir à ces besoins, Sabine mène comme activité depuis quinze ans, la vente des poissons dans sa région. Sabine s’approvisionne auprès d'une lagune du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Sabine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe JESUSIHUHLONTE, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Jesusihuhlonte is a group made up of four persons who are friends living in the same neighborhood.   The group is requesting a loan from ALIDé, for the first time in order to increase their working capital. The group representative whose name is Sabine has her hand raised on the photo.

Sabine is 34 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a fisherman named Germain. The couple has five children, all of them attend school and are their dependents. Sabine lives together with her children and her husband and together they provide for the various needs of the household. To meet her needs, Sabine has been selling fish in the region for the last 15 years. She gets her supplies from a lagoon in Benin. 

With the goal to meet her customers' demand and to increase her turnover and income, Sabine and the other members of the Jesusihuhlonte group are requesting a first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to purchase fish.

loans.name: Mekar Jadi Pondoan Group

texts.en:
The Mekar Jadi Pondoan group is made up of ten women who are neighbors in the same village in Sangketan, the middle part of Bali. The group is seeking a loan of 25M Indonesian rupiah (IDR) and each member will receive 2.5M IDR. The group was formed out of these women’s common interest in raising pigs to supplement family income and out of their interest in education on best practices for pig raising. This is their first loan with MUK.

Ni Nyoman, age 47, is the head of the Mekar Jadi Pondoan group. She is married and has one adult son. Her husband earns money as a farmer, but Ni Nyoman would like to help support her family with her pig raising business. She plans to sell the piglets after six months for use as pork. With the increase in household income, she hopes to be able to buy more pigs.

loans.use: to purchase piglets

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es:
Blanca, vive en casa propia, en el mismo terreno vive su hijo con la esposa, Blanca se dedica la administración de una tienda y en la venta de meriendas, este negocio lo practica desde hace mucho tiempo por la necesidad de mantener ingresos y de mantenerse ocupada.
Solicita un préstamo para poderlo invertir en la compra de productos básicos y preparación para la merienda por ejemplo aceite, arroz, carnes, embutidos, pastas, productos de aseo personal, utensilios desechables, esta compra le ayudara para poder mantener los dos negocios y así poder mejorar la atención a los clientes.

Su aspiración es en el futuro poder mejorar su hogar con las ganancias que le provean los negocios, con una condición estable y al mismo tiempo poder mejorar sus productos.
texts.en:
Blanca lives in her own house on the same land where her son and his wife live.  She runs a store and sells food, and has been in business for quite some time since she needed to earn an income and stay busy.

She is requesting a loan to buy basic products for the food she makes, such as oil, rice, meats, sausages, pasta, personal hygiene products, and disposable utensils.  This purchase will help her keep both businesses running so she can improve her customer service.

Her goal for the future is to renovate her house with earnings from the businesses once they are stable, and to improve her product line.

loans.use: To buy oil, rice, meats, sausages and personal hygiene products.

loans.name: Rann's Group

texts.en:
Rann, 32, is a mother of three children and is living in the Kror Kor district of Pursat Province in which her businesses are running. Some of her children are still in school while the remaining is helping the family's business activities.

She has been planting paddy rice on two hectares of farmland as the major source of income. To increase her family's profit, she raises pigs and runs a small stall at home to sell grocery items. She has been with these businesses for 18 years and currently is able to earn about 15,000 KHR.

Rann's group consists of 4 members; this is her first loan cycle and she is a group leader. She is applying for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR while two members are seeking 1,400,000 KHR each and the remaining one is seeking 1,200,000 KHR.

For her loan portion, she will buy fertilizer and gasoline for pumping water for her rice field, and some portion of it to pay the harvesting fee. She hopes to make more income in order to keep her children in school until the tertiary level.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, gasoline for pumping water and to pay harvesting fee

loans.name: Mandis Israel

texts.es:
Mandis, vive con su madre y unos hermanos, todos están en el mismo terreno pero en diferentes viviendas, él es padre de familia, sus hijos están mayores de edad, es dueño de un bus en el cual brinda servicio de transporte colectivo, esto surgió como una iniciativa para poder trabajar y poder tener ingresos a su familia.

Solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en la reparación de la unidad móvil, comprándose la bomba de aire y reparación de puertas en la parte trasera del bus, el préstamo le ayudará a solventar una necesidad en su fuente de trabajo, ya que estará dándole mantenimiento al bus y ofrecer una mejor condición a sus clientes al momento de transporte.

Su objetivo es crecer en el transporte de pasajeros, comprándose una nueva unidad, ya que esto le dará una mejor seguridad económica frente a las necesidades familia.
texts.en:
Mandis lives with his mother and siblings, all on the same land but in different dwellings.  He has a family and adult children.  He owns a bus that he uses for group transport, which is a business he thought up to work and earn an income for his family.

He is requesting a loan to repair his vehicle by buying an air pump, and to repair the doors on the back of the bus.  The loan will help him cover the necessities that arise in his work, such as bus maintenance and better transport conditions for his customers.

His goal is to grow in the passenger transportation business and buy a new vehicle so he can earn a more stable income to meet family obligations.

loans.use: To buy an air pump and repair the doors on the back of the bus.

loans.name: Melodina

texts.en:
Melodina is a 57-year-old woman from the town of Loon, Bohol.  She is married to her carpenter husband and they have five children together.  For 10 years now, she has been engaged in a sari-sari store business (general store) as well as raising pigs for a living.  Melodina’s challenges include her limited funds to replenish her stock on time and enough supply of feed to fatten her hogs.

She is asking for a loan to buy rice, snack food, canned goods, toiletries, seasoning, feed and, if possible, more piglets to raise. Any additional income that she will generate will be used for her family's daily consumption and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy rice, snack food, canned goods, toiletries, seasoning, feed and, if possible, more piglets to raise

loans.name: Lino

texts.es:
El Sr. Lino tiene 62 años, está casado con la Sra. Guillerma de 64 años con quien tiene 2 hijos, ambos casados y viven con sus respectivas familias.
El Sr. Lino es taxista desde hace 37 años  y tiene su parada sobre en la ciudad de Fernando de La Mora, donde ya tiene muy buena clientela, porque es conocido por el buen servicio que da a sus clientes.
El Sr. Lino solicita el préstamo para la reparación y mantenimiento de su vehículo para poder trabajar sin ningún inconveniente.
texts.en:
Lino, 62, is married to Guillerma, 64, and they have two adult children who are married and have their own families.

Lino has been a taxi driver for 37 years and his stop is in the city of Fernando de la Mora where he has a good customer base because of the good customer service he provides.

He is requessting a loan to repair and maintain his vehicle so he can work without any inconveniences.

loans.use: To repair and maintain his taxi.

loans.name: Delma

texts.en:
Delma is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. Delma has a furniture shop that makes and sells beds, cabinets and chairs made from rattan. She has had this business for 15 years.

She requested a loan for 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy materials for furniture making. Delma is a member of HSPFI this year, 2012. Delma's future outlook in life is that she will be able to improve her business and that she could get more buyers, both local and abroad, so that she could earn more income. She really has positive plans for her children: that she could be able to send all to school to finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy materials for making rattan furnitures

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruits to resell

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 40 years old and from Maribojoc, Bohol. She is married and a mother to 3 children ages 4, 7 and 12. 

She is married to a tricycle driver. She would like to be a better spouse to him by helping him earn their livelihood. 

For six years now, she has been engaged in raising pigs for a living. She is asking for a loan to buy 2 piglets and 2 sacks of feed. 

Gina plans to make her pig raising business bigger someday. Right now, her income will be used for school fees and food consumption.

loans.use: to buy 2 piglets and 2 sacks of feed.

loans.name: Haat's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Kror Kor district, Haat is a 47-year-old mother of 8 children, all of whom are still under her responsibility. Five children are still in school or below schooling age while the remaining three are working at a factory for a low salary. 

To overcome the family's hardship, Haat and her husband have grown paddy rice on two hectares of farmland for 25 years.  To add more income, she sells Khmer noodles from home whilst her husband works for others for a fee. Together, they are able to earn about 29,000 KHR per day. 

Haat has borrowed from VisionFund 4 times and she has managed to pay back the full loans with success. The loans have helped her to keep her children at school and set aside some money for emergency cases in the future. 

Now, she is applying for a new loan with VisionFund, Kiva's partner. She leads a group of three female members. She is seeking 1,400,000 KHR and the other two members are requesting 1,000,000 KHR each. She will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and to pay plowing fees. She hopes that she will earn more income from her current businesses so that she can finish fixing her house.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay plowing fees.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Juan, tiene 28 años de edad, vive con su esposa y un hijo de tres años, la vivienda es propia, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y ajonjolí, desde hace seis años está trabajando en lo propio y aprendió a trabajar a través de sus padres quienes también han realizado el mismo oficio.

El solicita un préstamo para comprarse siete sacos de abono y semillas de maíz, ya que esto le ayudará a poder ejecutar su trabajo en la siembra de verano, este crédito representa un gran aporte para Juan ya que tendrá los insumos para poder sacar una buena cosecha.

La aspiración de Juan de superarse económicamente a través de su trabajo, para poder ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan, 28, lives with his wife and three-year-old son in their own house.  He grows corn and sesame and has been working on his own for six years.  He learned the trade from his parents who were also farmers.

He is requesting a loan to buy seven sacks of fertilizer and corn seeds, as this will help him carry out the summer sowing season.  The loan is of great help to Juan because it means he will have the supplies he needs for a good harvest.

Juan's goal is to improve his economy through his work, so he can offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy seven sacks of fertilizer and corn seeds.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong, 58, is a married woman who lives in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has three children, one of whom is still dependent on her and also helps the family’s business. To earn the family’s living, she has been in rice farming on two-hectares of farmland and devoted her spare time in planting cassava on two-hectares of farmland for additional income. Having been in this business for thirty-three years, they both can earn approximately 50,000 KHR per day and can manage to save about 20,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

Kong has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for four loan cycles, and she successfully paid back the past loans which have helped her relieve her family’s burden. Now she is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 KHR from VisionFund. With this loan she is going to buy fertilizers, plow her farmland, use a portion of it to spend for labor and purchase an extra plot of farmland to increase her rice output. She hopes to increase her income from the current business so as to improve her family’s living condition. In the future, Kong plans to buy a tractor for tilling the farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and plow her farmland

loans.name: Ana Luisa

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer de 32 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 pequeños hijos en la ciudad de Ica, ella  es una mujer muy trabajadora y entusiasta, Ana siempre ha trabajado desde muy joven, ya que tiene un gran deseo de superación, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo estudiar la carrera de Educación que tanto quería, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar con sus pequeños y en algunas ocasiones cocina un delicioso “Arroz con Pato” para engreír a su familia.
