Gracias a su espíritu emprendedor y al apoyo de su esposo, Ana puso en marcha una pequeña cevichería, donde vende ceviche y chilcano, ella se levanta muy temprano para dejar todo preparado y listo para atender a sus comensales, Ana dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 7 horas diarias, en las cuales puede atender a un promedio de 50 clientes; ella cree que su negocio marcha bien debido  a que es conocida y recomendada por sus clientes por su buena sazón y trato amable; adicionalmente los fines de semana trabaja como niñera en una guardería cercana a su hogar. 
Ana se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mesas, sillas y mercadería, tales como gaseosas y agua mineral; de esta manera podrá contar con un negocio mejor acondicionado y abastecido, así Ana espera atender a mayor cantidad de clientes e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, y así poco a poco espera ahorrar el dinero necesario para convertir su pequeño negocio en un buen restaurante.
texts.en:
Ana, 32, lives with her husband and their three children in the city of Ica  She is a hard-working, enthusiastic woman.  Ana has worked ever since she was very young, because of her great desire for success.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources, she was unable to study even though that is what she wanted to do.  In her free time she enjoys playing with the children, and sometimes she makes them the delicious "rice with duck" that the family loves.

Thanks to her entrepreneurial spirit and support from her husband, Ana set up a small "cevichería" food business, selling ceviche (fish) and chilcano (fish broth).  She gets up early in the morning to get everything prepared and ready to attend to her customers.  She spends about seven hours a day at work, and attends to an average 50 customers a day.  She believes her business is successful because she is well-known and recommended by her customers because of her tasty cuisine and kindness.  On weekends she works as a caregiver at a nearby children's day-care center.

Ana is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to their support she is able to buy tables, chairs and merchandise such as sodas and mineral water.  This will mean her business will be better prepared and stocked.  Ana hopes to be able to attract more customers so she can increase her income and save enough money over time to expand her small business into a good restaurant.

loans.use: To buy tables, chairs and merchandise, such as sodas and mineral water.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 41-year-old married woman from Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in farming for more than five years now. Teresita tills land together with her husband. They grow rice and other crops on their lot. 

Teresita works hard to earn a living so that she can help her husband meet the needs of the family. 

Teresita is asking for a loan worth 5000 PHP to buy additional fertilizers for the crops. She believes that this loan would be a great help for her in improving their livelihood. With this, she can augment their income and be given the chance to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizers for crops.

loans.name: Anhmurun

texts.en:
Mrs Anhmurun is 29 years old and lives with her husbund and two children in a ger in Umnugovi province, Mongolia. Her husband is a driver at a coal mine. Her son goes to secondary school and her daughter goes to a kindergarten. She is trying to start her garment retailing business at a rental counter. Her new sales location is good and her garments are relatively cheap for such products. She wants to have her own store in the future.

She's a hardworking woman who is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to purchase products. Because a new academic year is starting soon, demand for the product will increase. She says "I am starting to work to save for my children's future. They will soon go to college therefore I have to prepare for their college tuition."

loans.use: to purchase products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy banana in making banana-Q, a popular fried banana street food.

loans.name: Manuel Aparicio

texts.es:
Manuel, vive con su esposa y tiene cinco hijos mayores de edad, viven en casa propia, El tiene 49 años y se dedica al trabajo agrícola sembrando maíz, esta actividad la realiza desde muy joven cuando aún vivía con sus padres, ya que eran agricultores y le enseñaron este trabajo.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, para aplicarlos al cultivo estos materiales le permiten a Manuel poder darle el cuidado necesario activo para prevenir la maleza y las plagas. Su aspiración es tener una buena cosecha y al mismo tiempo poderla comercializar para mejorar los ingresos a sus hijos en su esposa.
texts.en:
Manuel lives with his wife. He has five grown children who live on their own. He is 48 years old and works as a farmer, planting  corn. He has done this activity since he was very young, when he still lived with his parents, since they were farmers and they taught him this work.

He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, herbicide and insecticide to apply to his crop. These materials allow Manuel to give it active care to prevents weeds and pests.He aspires to having a good crop and also to sell it to improve his childrens' and his wife's income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide and insecticide.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. 

Elvira buys and sells beverages in her community. She has had this business for two years. She has requested a loan for 5,000 to purchase more beverages to resell.

Elvira has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Elvira hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase beverages to resell.

loans.name: Chhorn's Group

texts.en:
Chhorn, 64, is married with five children. He now lives with his wife in the Thmor Koul District of Battambang province as all of his children are currently working in a factory in Thailand. To earn a living, he plants paddy rice on two hectares of farmland. He has been doing this business for 20 years and is able to earn about 25,000 KHR per day.

Chhorn has been with VisionFund for six loan cycles. He has managed his loans very well to improve his current business and all loans were successfully repaid. Now, he has formed a group of three to apply for a new loan. He is requesting 1,400,000 KHR and the other two members are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each. As the group leader, he will use his loan portion to buy four sacks of fertilizer, seeds, and to pay plowing fees. He expects to gain more crop yields so that he can make a better living.

loans.use: to buy four sacks of fertilizer, seeds, and to pay a plowing fee.

loans.name: Rose Fe

texts.en:
Rose Fe, 34, lives in the Philippines and is married with three children. She sells charcoal in her community, a business she has had for five years. She has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy more charcoal for resale.

Rose Fe has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en:
Oun, 44, makes a living by growing rice on three hectares of farmland. She has been engaged in this business for almost thirty years and she earns approximately 60,000 KHR per day to satisfy her family’s needs. She lives with her husband and their four children, two sons and two daughters, in Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Cambodia. Low crop yield is still her main challenge, which is due to a shortage of capital to support her farming business.

Oun has received loans with VisionFund for two cycles while the other member is just with VisionFund this cycle. Oun has successfully managed her past loans to better support her family’s livelihood. Now Oun and her fellow group member are applying for loans of 1,000,000 KHR and 500,000 KHR respectively. As the leader, Oun is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and will also use a portion of it to pay labor costs for plowing. She hopes this loan will enable her to achieve good living conditions through the positive impact of the loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 47 years old. She is married to Peter, and together they have two children. She sells GNLD vitamins and supplements and has been in the business for the last five years.

This is her first loan with KADET LTD. She will use the loan to purchase stocks of herbal supplements for resale in her business.

She hopes to rent a room where she can stock her products rather than hawk them.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and supplements for resale.

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es:
Salvador, tiene 57 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus hijos, la vivienda en la que reside es propia, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz en seis manzanas de terreno, aprendió desde muy pequeño esta actividad ya que su padre se lo enseño, hoy en día esta actividad se ha vuelto la necesidad para poder obtener el alimento familiar, trabaja con sus hijos y también paga algunos mozos.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales necesarios en la actividad agrícola como el abono y semilla mejorada, también el pago del alquiler terreno y compra de herbicidas, con estos materiales podrá iniciar su trabajo ya que el crédito le ayudara dándole los recursos económicos para que pueda garantizar una buena inversión y mejorar la cosecha.

Su aspiración es que sus cultivos sean abundantes, ya que esto ayudará a poder generar una mejor condición a su familia también quiere apoyar a sus hijos para que estos puedan superarse.
texts.en:
Salvador is 57 years old. He lives with his wife and children in a house that they own. He grows corn on six plots of land. He learned this activity when he was very young because his father taught it to him. Today this activity is necessary to feed his family. He works with his children and he also pays some laborers.

He is asking for a loan to buy the necessary materials for farming, such as fertilizer and improved seed, as well as to pay for rent on the land and to buy herbicides. With these materials, he will be able to start his work, since the loan will help him by giving him the financial resources to guarantee a good investment and to improve the harvest. 

His goal is for his crops to be abundant, since this will help him generate better conditionsfor his family. He also wants to support his children so that they can get ahead.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and improved seeds as well as to pay rent on the land.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong is a 43-year-old married woman who lives with her husband in the rural village of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. They don’t have any children yet. 

To make a living, she has been growing rice on one hectare of farmland and planting one hectare with cassava. She has been in this business for more than 10 years. From the current business, she is able to earn about KHR 20,000 per day and can save around KHR 8,000 each day after daily expenses.

Hong has been with VisionFund for four cycles and has successfully paid back the past loans, which have helped her alleviate her family’s burden. Now she is asking for a new loan of $1,000, with which she will buy fertilizer and pay for labor. 

She hopes that she will be able to better her living status. In the future, she wants to buy a decent car for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
Azucena is 26 years old and from the town of Maribojoc, Bohol. Her husband works as a laborer, and she helps by cooking snack foods, like rice cakes and pancakes, while looking after their two children, ages 5 and 11 months. 

She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients like cooking oil, white sugar and flour. Azucena is optimistic that her life will change for the better as long as she works hard. Her income will be used for food, milk and diapers.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like cooking oil, white sugar and flour

loans.name: Anne Marie

texts.fr: Anne marie est une jeune femme agée de 37 ans, célibataire, mère de 3 enfants  dont l'age varie entre 5 et 16 ans, et tous vont déjà à l'école. Elle a un restaurant qu'elle gère depuis 2 ans déjà. Elle achète le plus souvant les aliments de son restaurant en détail(riz, huile poisson, viande, arachides et boisson), elle sollicite ce crédit pour augmenter le stock de ces aliments (en gros)en achetant le riz en sac, les bidons d'huile ainsin que les seaux d'arachide ce qui lui permettra non seulement de satisfaire sa clientèle déjà grandissante, mais aussi de réaliser un bénéfice plus élévé qui l'aidera à subvenir à certains besoins quotidiens et d'économiser pour la scolarisation de ses enfants et aussi d'agrandir son restaurant avec le temps en réinvestissant le reste dans son activté.
texts.en: Anne Marie is a 37-year-old woman and the mother of 3 children aged between 5 and 16, all of whom currently go to school. She has been running a restaurant for 2 years already. She most often buys the ingredients for her restaurant (rice, oil, fish, meat, groundnuts and drinks) retail, and is requesting this loan so that she can increase her stock of ingredients by buying them wholesale; buying bags of rice, cans of oil and buckets of groundnuts will not only allow her to satisfy her already growing customer clientèle, but also to earn higher profits, which will enable her to meet some of her daily needs, to save for her children's education and, over time, to expand her restaurant by reinvesting in her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, cans of oil and buckets of groundnuts.

loans.name: Phalary's Group

texts.en:
Phalary, 44, is a single woman residing in the Kang Meas district of Kampong Cham province. She is a teacher in the local area and also grows rice and sells grocery items to earn additional income. Having been engaged in this business for nine years, she is able to earn 16,400 KHR per day. The main challenge for her is low crop yields due to flooding that has ruined her rice.

Phalary is leading this group of two members who live in the same village to apply for their first microloans with VisionFund of 1,000,000 KHR each. She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland, as well as to buy more grocery items such as salt, sugar, eggs, etc. She hopes that her crop yields will be increased and become more profitable so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland and grocery items.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas district

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia is one of Esperanza International's entrepreneurs. She came to Esperanza International almost five years ago for a loan to expand her jewel sales business. She joined the group "United for the Future" in one of the rural villages in Santo Domingo, where she has received loans to invest in her business. 

Felicia is a single mother with two children who she is raising by herself without the help of a husband. She lives in a small slum community in Santo Domingo's north. Felicia is receiving her ninth loan from Esperanza. She is accessing this loan to make some changes to the structure of her home. She has been building her house little by little and this time the loan will be used to lay a floor and finish some walls. Felicia will invest this loan by purchasing cement and other building materials. 

Esperanza Internacional is running a program where most of their clients pay back their loans, fulfill their commitment to expand their businesses, and show fidelity to their groups. They can request loans to improve their house structure while receiving business loans and attending group meetings.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and other building materials.

loans.name: Hani

texts.en:
Hani, 45, is the married father of three children. He has been working in clothing sales for 24 years. In 2005, he opened his current shop selling women's clothing and accessories and he is so happy with the number of visitors. Hani is very proud of himself because through the good quality products he is selling, he is attracting more and more customers.

Hani is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to change the external brick canopy outside his shop before the fall and winter seasons. This change is very necessary both to improve the image of his shop and at the same time to attract customers hiding from the rain under it, as they will definitely look inside and pay attention to the beautiful collection he sells.

This is Hani's third cycle as a Al Majmoua borrower. His previous loans helped a lot in improving his business and he was a good standing borrower. He hopes to meet his customers expectations and more.

loans.use: to change the external brick canopy outside his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Magda Carina

texts.es: Para Magda el  negocio  de confección de ropa casual y de alta costura, es el resultado visible de su expresión creativa como profesional del diseño. Desde sus 15 años ha estado trabajando muy cerca a confeccionistas y desde hace un año, después de ser empleada decidió independizarse, dando inicio a su sueño de convertirse en diseñadora de modas, aplicando el dinero recibido, producto de haber terminado su contrato de trabajo y su carrera como profesional del diseño. Su meta es lanzar una colección de ropa casual para damas y es por esto que requiere el apoyo de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización en la cual está aplicando a un credikiva, con el que planea  invertir en materias primas e insumos para dar su primer paso hacia el mundo competitivo del diseño y apostarle a su reconocimiento y posicionamiento en un mercado mucho mas estructurado. En la actualidad Magda tiene un taller, donde realiza todo el proceso productivo, desde la compra de materias primas, pasando por el diseño, corte, preparación, ensamble y acabado de piezas, hasta la comercialización. Su principal mercado son los jóvenes universitarios y ejecutivas de empresas que están convencidas de la calidad de los productos que Magda ofrece. Sus ventas las realiza a crédito y sus compras de contado y su mayor desafío es tener el capital de trabajo suficiente para sacar su colección y en por eso Magda trabaja de manera esmerada, diariamente desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde y de lunes a domingo; su capacidad de trabajo, disciplina y la calidad de lo que produce, son las fortalezas con las que le sale al paso, a una inmensa competencia en el mercado y por eso se sostiene. Esto es justamente el éxito de invertir un credikiva en su negocio, pues está en buenas manos.
texts.en: For Magda the clothes making and high fashion business is the visible result of her creative expression as a design professional. Since she was 15 years old, she has been working very closely with seamstresses. A year ago, after being an employee, she decided to go off on her own to follow her dream of being a fashion designer. She used the money she had from terminating her work contract and from her career as a design professional. Her goal is to start a collection a casual clothing for women and that is why she needs support from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, the organization where she is applying for a Kiva loan. With it, she plans on investing in raw materials to take the first step towards the competitive world of design and gain recognition and position in a much more structured market. Right now, Magda has a workshop where she does the whole productive process, from buying raw materials to design, cutting, preparation, assembly and finishing the pieces, and then selling them. Her main market are young college students and business executives who are persuaded by the quality of the products that Magda offers. She sells on credit and pays for her purchases up front. Her biggest challenge is having enough working capital to make her collection, and that is why she works so hard. She works every day from 8 in the morning until 5 in the afternoon from Monday through Sunday. Her work capacity, her discipline and the quality of work she produces are her strengths. She is getting ahead with a lot of competition in the market and that sustains her. That is the suxxess of investing a Kiva loan in her business; it will be in good hands.

loans.use: to invest in rawe materials to make the first step towards her first collection.

loans.name: Mas' Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural area of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, Mas is 44 years old and married with six children. Four of her children (two daughters and two sons) are dependent on her and still attend school. To make a sufficient living, Mas is involved in farming rice on one hectare of farmland and earns extra income by planting cassava on two hectares to support the family. She has been in this business for 20 years. The current business earns her approximately 20,000 KHR per day to meet her family's daily needs.

This is Mas’s first group loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is leading her group of two to apply for a loan with VisionFund. Mas will use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes her crop yields will become more productive so as to improve her family's lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
La Señora Miriam tiene 39 años de edad, vive en la zona de Sexta Parte, un cantón de Vinto, que es una provincia de Quillacollo al oeste de la ciudad de Cochabamba. Está casada con el Señor Alberto Vásquez con quien tiene tres hijos pequeños que aún dependen económicamente de ellos.
Miriam se dedica  la producción de leche y a la elaboración de quesillos. Todos los días Miriam y Alberto trabajan desde muy temprano en el ordeño de la leche y por la tarde Miriam realiza los quesillos para poder entregar a una persona que vende en el mercado de la zona de Vinto. Alberto trabaja en la empresa de semillas para la producción de papa en la localidad de Morochata.
El crédito que solicita es para la compra de soya para su ganado y de esa manera tener una buena producción, Miriam es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, de esa manera tendrán mayor ingreso y podrán dar una mejor educación a sus hijos ya que ellos no terminaron el colegio.
texts.en:
Miriam is 39 years old.  She lives in the zone of Sexta Parte, a region of Vinto, which is a province of Quillacollo to the west of the city Cochabamba.  She is married to Alberto Vásquez and they have three small children that still depend on them economically.  Miriam works in milk and fresh cheese production.  Every day, Miriam and Alberto work from very early milking the cows and in the afternoon Mirian makes the fresh cheeses to be able to deliver them to a person that sells them in a market in the region of Vinto.  Alberto works in a potato seed production company in the town of Morochata.

The loan they are requesting will be used to buy soy for their livestock, and through this have good production.  Miriam is a very responsible and hard-working person, and because of this they will have a larger income and will be able to give a better eduction to their children, since Miriam and Alberto didn't finish school.

loans.use: to buy soy for livestock

loans.name: Ayde

texts.es: La señora Ayde, es una persona de 19 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, alcanzo a estudiar el bachillerato en humanidades, vive actualmente en casa de sus padres y no cuenta con dependientes económicos a cargo. La actividad económica de la clienta es la producción agrícola, los productos que cultiva son la papa, haba y cebada;  produce especialmente la papa durante dos épocas de la gestión y en sus terrenos propios que se hallan situadas en la comunidad de Sankayani Alto del municipio de Tíraque distante aproximadamente a unos 78 Km. desde la ciudad de Cochabamba. La señora Ayde manifiesta ser una persona trabajadora y responsable que quiere superarse e incrementar su productividad  y para tal efecto se ve en la necesidad de solicitar capital de inversión para la compra de insumos agrícolas que a corto plazo le permitirá obtener mayores  ingresos económicos que vayan a mejorar sus condiciones de vida que ella espera tener.
texts.en:
Ayde, 19, is single.  She attended a humanities high school.  She currently lives in her parents’ house and does not have any dependents in her care.  Her economic activity is agriculture; she grows potatoes, lima beans and barley.  She mainly produces potatoes in two seasons on farmland of her own located in the community of Sankayani Alto in Tíraque Municipality about 78 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba.  

Ayde states that she’s a hardworking, responsible person who wants to improve and increase productivity and to do so needs to request investment capital to buy farm supplies that will lead to higher income in the short term and to the improved living conditions she wants to attain.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en:
Oun, 47, lives in a rural village in the Moung Russey District of Battambang Province. She has a big family consisting of seven children living together, some of whom attend school while others support the family's business activities. For her children's sake, Oun has been working on six hectares of farmland for growing paddy rice. She started her business six years ago and now she can earn about 28,000 KHR per day. The main challenges for her are drought and insects that make her crop yields fruitless. 
This will be Oun's third loan with Kiva partner VisionFund. She has formed a group of two to request a new loan in order to sustain her business. Her past two loans have made her feel confident in gradually improving her standard of living. Oun is seeking a loan of 1,400,000 KHR and the other group member is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. Oun, as the group leader, will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her rice field. She hopes to earn more income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her rice field.

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Renato is a 32-year-old married man from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. For the past three years, he has been a farmer. Renato's farm income sustains his family, especially his children, and he works hard to support his family. Renato joined CEVI to have access to the financial services offered by the organization. 

Renato is requesting a 4,000 PHP loan to buy additional fertilizer for the plants that he is growing. He dreams of expanding his business venture to increase his income. He hopes to become financially capable of sending his children to school so they can have a better education. Renato adds that he wants to save some of his earnings for future use.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Octavia

texts.es: La señora Octavia, es una persona de 39 años de edad, de estado civil casada, alcanzo a estudiar la primaria, vive en su casa propia y cuenta con seis dependientes económicos a cargo los cuales son sus hijos. La actividad económica principal de la clienta y su familia es la producción agrícola y los principales productos que cultiva  son la papa, haba, arveja y cebada en sus terrenos heredados por parte de sus padres que se hallan situadas en las comunidades de Toralapa Baja y Pucara Grande del municipio de Tíraque que están distantes a unos 70 Km. desde la ciudad de Cochabamba. La señora Octavia y su familia manifiestan ser personas trabajadoras y responsables que quieren superarse y seguir incrementando su producción agrícola y para tal efecto se ve en la necesidad de solicitar capital de inversión para la compra de abono de gallinaza y semilla de papa que es el principal cultivo que producen y de tal forma poder mejorar la calidad de vida de sus dependientes.
texts.en:
Octavia is a 39 year old person, who is married and finished studying through primary school, and she lives in a house of her own with six dependents, which are her children.  Her primary economic activity ad that of her family is in agriculture, and their principal crops are potatoes, broad beans, peas, and barley, which they grow on the property she inherited from her parents.  They are situated in the communities of Toralapa Baja and Pucara Grande in the municipality of Tíraque about 70 Kilometers distance from the city of Cochabamba. 

Sra. Octavia and her family state that they are hardworking and responsible people who want to be successful, and they want to continue increasing their agricultural production, and for this to happen, they need to have more investment capital to buy chicken manure for fertilizer and seed potatoes, which is their primary crop.  In this way, they will be able to improve their quality of life for their dependents.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer made of chicken manure.

loans.name: Edilyn

texts.en:
Edilyn is 39 years old and is married with two children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past five years, Edilyn has operated a shop where she sells rice by the kilo. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.

Edilyn is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to buy sacks of rice to sell. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Farqana

texts.en:
Farqana is a 34-year-old woman who is married with three children. For the past 10 years, she has worked as a market vendor selling goods such as flour, beverages, macaroni, butter, and candies. Farqana  has a deep knowledge of the market and client demand. She also breeds cattle. Farqana's food products are very popular and in high demand and she earns 200 AZN monthly. Her husband helps with purchasing products and bringing them to the shop. This business is the sole income for her family. Farqana is a very successful entrepreneur and her shop is in a good location in the central bazaar of her  home city.

Farqana is requesting a 1,200 AZN loan to purchase more food products and diversify the range of goods she offers to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Elsy Estela

texts.es:
Elsy, tiene 22 años de edad, vive con su madre, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, ya que con esta actividad apoya su madre con los gastos del hogar pues la realizan juntas, lleva tres años realizando esta actividad en el mercado todos los días.

Ella solicita un préstamo para comprarse seis quintales de maíz y dos cilindros de gas propano, esto le ayudará a fortalecer el negocio y a seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio con la producción de las tortillas.

Aspira poder mejorar a través del negocio su situación económica, poder generar una condición más estable para permanecer trabajando.
texts.en:
Elsy is 22 years old. She lives with her mother, and she works selling tortillas. With this activity she helps her mother with the household expenses, since they work together. She has done this work for three years, going to the market every day. 

She is requesting a loan to buy six quintal sacks of corn and two cylinders of propane gas. This will help her strengthen the business and continue offering good service with her tortilla production. 

Her aspiration is to be able to improve her economic situation through the business, and to create a more stable situation so that she can keep working.

loans.use: to buy six large sacks of corn and two cylinders of propane gas.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 38 years old and married. The couple is blessed with one child whom they support. For the past 12 years, Simon has operated a business selling fertilizer and he earns a monthly income of 25,000 KES. 

Simon is requesting his first loan through KADET LTD to purchase more than 5,000 different packages of fertilizer and pesticide to enable him to meet the market demand of his customers. He will invest the profit from his loan back into his business. In the future, Simon plans to have a stable business.

loans.use: to buy 5,000 packages of fertilizer and pesticide to sell

loans.name: Eney

texts.en: Eney is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Eney has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, where she sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has run this business for 11 years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Eney has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Eney hopes to improve her business so that she is able to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Marco

texts.es:
Marco es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en una habitación en alquiler en la zona Irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente percibe ingresos gracias  a la elaboración y arreglo de todo tipo de trabajos en general relacionados con madera, trabajando por más de doce horas el ingreso que tiene no le alcanza para aumentar su capital ya que debe cubrir los gastos de alquiler, alimentación y pago de servicios básicos.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de madera y pegamento para la elaboración de sus pedidos ya que desea incrementar sus ingresos para tener un anticretico por que gasta mucho en los pagos de sus alquileres.
El sueño de Marco, es mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
Es la tercera vez que solicita el crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Marco is single and has no children.  He lives in a rented room in the District of Irpavi of the city of La Paz.

Marco currently earns his living by making and repairing all type of items made from wood.  He works more than 12 hours, but the income he generates is not enough to increase his capital so that he can cover expenses such as rent, food, and basic services.  The loan he is requesting will be used to buy wood and glue so that he can produce items to complete his orders.  He wants to increase his income so that he can acquire property through an “anticretico” contract because he pays too much for rent.  

Marco’s dream is to improve his income and his quality of life.  This is the third time he has requested a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy wood and glue.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.es:
Ninfa esta casada y tiene dos hijos los cuales están en etapa escolar, viven en casa propia ocupando dos habitaciones pequeñas, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz.
Ninfa, estudió costura a nivel técnico superior, actualmente percibe ingresos porque se dedica a la confección de trajes para varones y mujeres ya que debe cubrir los gastos de educación y alimentación de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de tela y demás material para la confección de sus trajes para posteriormente venderlos y de esta forma mejorar sus ingresos ya que es la única fuente de ingresos que tiene para mantener a su familia.
El sueño de Ninfa, es construir más habitaciones en su casa y ampliar su taller para mayor comodidad.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Ninfa is married and has two children who are of school age.  They live in their own home where they occupy two small rooms.  Their house is located in the District of Irpavi in the city of La Paz.

Ninfa studied sewing through higher-level technical courses.  She currently generates income by producing outfits for men and women.  This enables her to cover the cost of educating and feeding her family.  The loan she is requesting will be used to buy fabric and other materials used in making outfits that she will sell later.  This will improve her earnings since sewing is the only source of income she has to sustain her family.

Ninfa’s dream is to add two more rooms to her house and to expand her workshop so that she will be more comfortable.  This is the second time she has worked with IMPRO and the second time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy fabric and other sewing materials.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora esta casada y tiene cinco hijos con los cuales vive en casa propia ocupando dos habitaciones pequeñas que tienen paredes de adobe y el piso de tierra, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz.
La cliente estudio solo hasta la primaria y actualmente trabaja por más de diez horas elaborando y vendiendo queso de forma ambulante ya que debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación y educación de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para aumentar su capital para la producción de queso y de esta forma mejorar sus ingresos ya que es la única fuente de ingresos que tiene para mantener a su familia.
El sueño de Teodora es  construir más habitaciones ya  que desea tener más comodidad ya que son siete integrantes y viven en dos habitaciones es por esa razón que desea mejorar sus ingresos.
Es la novena vez que solicita el crédito junto a IMPRO y la sexta vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Teodora is married and has five children.  She and her family live in their own home where they occupy two small rooms that consist of adobe walls and dirt floors.  Their house is located in the District of Irpavi in the city of La Paz.

Teodora only completed elementary school.  At the moment, she works more than 10 hours making cheese and selling her products as a street vendor.  This enables her to cover the cost of feeding and educating her family.  The loan she is requesting will increase her capital for producing cheese so that she can improve her earnings.  This is the only source of income she has by which she is able to sustain her family.  

Teodora’s dream is to build two more rooms because she wants her family to be more comfortable since there are seven members.  They live in two rooms, so she wants to improve her income.  

This is the ninth time she has requested a loan from IMPRO and the sixth time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making cheese.

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es:
Hilaria no esta casada pero tiene dos hijos que están en etapa escolar, viven en la casa de sus padres ocupando dos habitaciones, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Sopocachi de la ciudad de La  Paz.
Actualmente percibe ingresos ya que trabaja como profesora de primaria por más de ocho horas en un colegio fiscal ya que debe cubrir los gastos de educación, alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
Es por eso que solicita el crédito para la refacción de su habitación para realizar el acabado fino ya que actualmente tiene paredes de ladrillo y con lo que gana no le alcanza para la refacción.
El sueño de Hilaria, es tener mejores ingresos para adquirir un anticrético y dar más comodidad a su familia.
Es la tercera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la tercera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Hilaria is not married but has two children who are of school age.  They live at her parents’ house where they occupy two rooms.  The house is located in the District of Sopocachi in the city of La Paz.  

Hilaria currently earns income by working as an elementary school teacher.  She works more than eight hours at a state school in order to cover expenses such as education, food, and basic services for her family.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan to repair a room so that it will be completely finished.  The room has brick walls, but she does not earn enough money to complete the repairs.  

Hilaria’s dream is to have more income in order to acquire property through an “anticrético” contract so that her family will be more comfortable.  This is the third time she has worked with IMPRO, and the third with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for repairs to a room.

loans.name: Santos Agustin

texts.es:
Santos tiene 36 años, el cual vive en el distrito de Santiago, Ica, Perú.  El distrito de Santiago, el distrito de Santiago se caracteriza por su agricultura en especial de la siembre de esparrago y la cosecha de uva, asimismo en él se ubican varias agropexportadoras que brinda muchos puestos de trabajo en la zona. Santos convive con su esposa y juntos son padres de 2 hijos de 2 y 12 años y por los cuales trabajan mucho porque quieren que darles una vida digna y sobre todo sean mejores que ellos. Como buen peruano a Santos le gusta mucho la comida típica de nuestro país y uno de sus platos favoritos es el riquísimo “ceviche”, en sus tiempos libre les gusta ver partidos de futbol, ya que lo distrae mucho. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos Santos tuvo que dejar de estudiar la carrera de Agronomía y dedicarse a su trabajo.

Con mucho entusiasmo Santos trabaja como agricultor, actualmente ha sembrado en su parcela algodón y diariamente le dedica alrededor de 9 horas diarias, ya que siempre está al tanto de que este bien regado; el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy responsable y sobre todo le gusta mucho lo que hace.

Santos está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar abono, fertilizantes y poder pagar para el abastecimiento de agua para regar su cultivo, de esta manera el podrá tener una buena cosecha y mejorar sus ingresos, de esta manera el seguirá trabajando muy duro para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a sus hijos y poder tener más”.
texts.en:
Santos is 36 years old and he lives in the district of Santiago, Ica, Peru. The district of Santiago is famous for its agriculture, growing in particular asparagus and grapes; on top of this, various agro-export companies can be found here, offering many job chances in the area. Santos lives with his wife and with their 2 children aged 2 and 12, for whom they work hard because they want to offer them a dignified life and because they want them to become better professionals than themselves. Being a good Peruvian, Santos loves the country’s typical food, one of his favorite dishes being the delicious “ceviche”. In his free time he likes watching soccer games, as they distract him a lot. Owing to his meager economic resources, Santos had to stop studying agronomy to engage himself in his activity.

Santo is a farmer and he works with great enthusiasm. He has just planted cotton in his plot of land, dedicating to it almost 9 hours a day, as this crop needs to be properly irrigated. He thinks her job is going well because he is very responsible and above all because he loves what he does.

Santos is deeply grateful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to their help he will buy manure, and fertilizers and he will be able to pay for the water supply he needs to irrigate his crops. In this way he will get a good harvest and will increase his earnings, therefore keeping on working very hard in order to make his biggest dream come true: “To provide his children with a good education and to become richer”.

loans.use: To buy manure, fertilizers and to pay for water supply.

loans.name: Pedro Renne

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 56 años, su vivienda se ubica en el distrito de Santiago, el cual se caracteriza por el desarrollo de la agricultura en especial el cultivo de uva, esparrago, paprika, entre otros, asimismo se encuentran muchas empresas agroexportadoras, la cuales brindan muchos puestos de trabajo para los pobladores del distrito. Cuando tiene un tiempito libre a Pedro le gusta mucho comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “chicharrón de Pollo”. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos él solo estudio hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar “Ingeniería Civil”.

Día a día Pedro trabaja como empleado en la municipalidad de su distrito, el trabaja en el área de limpieza y mantenimiento de parques y jardines, el trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y el cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y porque le gusta su trabajo y lo hace con muchas ganas.

Pedro está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le ha brindado el podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda, en especial refaccionar las paredes ya que a raíz del terremoto del año 2007, estas se resquebrajaron y ahora están más agrietadas y son un peligro para su familia, con ello el podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida y podrá seguir trabajando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Pedro is 56 years old. His  home is located in the district of Santiago, which is known for it's agriculture, especially for growing grapes, asparagus and paprika, among other things. There are many agricultural exporters in the area, which provide many jobs to those that live in the district. When Pedro has free time he enjoys eating one of his favorite dishes, “Chicharrón de Pollo” (a fried chicken dish). Because of his limited economic resources, he was only able to study through 5th grade elementary school, but had it been possible he would have liked to study civil engineering. 

Day to day Pedro works as an employee for the municipality of his district. He works in the department of cleaning and maintenance of parks and gardens. He works around 9 hours a day and he believes he does well in his job because he is very responsible and because he likes his job and does it with great enthusiasm.  

Pedro is very thankful to Kiva loaners; thanks to the help they have provided he will be able to accomplish home improvements, specifically repairing the walls that were damaged during the 2007 earthquake, which are now cracking more and are a danger to his family. With this improvement he will have a better quality of life and he will be able to continue working to make his biggest dream, of having his own home, a reality.

loans.use: to complete home improvements, like repairing the walls.

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
Este Comité Mujeres llamado Santa Librada tiene 12 integrantes  en donde todas trabajan arduamente por ayudar a sus familias por medio de su esfuerzo y trabajo y asi salir adelante.
Lidia es parte de este trabajador grupo, se dedica a la venta de prendas de segunda mano. Cuenta que empezó con unos pocos clientes, pero que después fue creciendo de a poco y hoy en día ya tiene muy buena clientela que siempre le hace muchos pedidos.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de segunda mano, con lo cual podrá cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes y así también tener mejores ingresos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This communal bank, named Santa Librada, has twelve female members who all work arduously to help their families, in order to get ahead through their work and effort.

Lidia belongs to this hard-working group. She works selling used clothing items. She says she started out with a few customers, but later she started expanding little by little, and currently she has a very good customer base and receives lots of orders.

She is requesting the loan to purchase used clothing items so that she can respond to her customers' demand and also so that she can have better income to offer her customers.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing items for sale.

loans.name: Ykua Vera Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama “Ykua Vera”  en honor al barrio en donde viven, son 12 mujeres que se esfuerzan por salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias en todo lo que ellas pueden.
Jorgelina vende todo tipo de cosméticos y es gracias a que trabaja sin cansarse que puede dar a su familia todo lo que necesitan para no pasar por ningún tipo de necesidades. Su deseo es poder tener una tienda de productos en general, donde poder vender sus cosméticos y demás productos.
Jorgelina solicita el crédito para la compra de cosméticos, con lo cual podrá surtirse y tener buena variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes. Ella y sus amigas agradecen por la oportunidad que están recibiendo, pues les será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
This committee is named “Ykua Vera” in honor of the neighborhood they live in, and there are 12 women who have gathered their strength to help them move forward and to help their families in every way they can.

Jorgelina sells all different kind of cosmetics, and is thanks to doing this work which does not tire her out, that she can give her family all that they need without having to go without any of the necessities.  Her wish is to be able to have a store for general merchandise, where she would be able to sell cosmetics and more products.

Jorgelina is asking for a loan to buy cosmetics, with which she will restock and have a good variety to offer her customers.  She and her friends are thankful for the opportunity they are being given, as it will be a great help.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: 29 De Septiembre Group

texts.es:
El comité  “29 de Septiembre", actualmente se encuentra en el tercer ciclo, con 15 integrantes, ellas están contentas por trabajar con el comité, y agradecen por la oportunidad que están recibiendo.
Mirna es la presidenta del grupo y cuenta que se dedica a la cría y venta de animales. Dice que es un trabajo muy duro ya que es de tiempo completo, pues debe de estar pendiente de sus animales las 24 horas. Su meta es tener una gran granja donde poder tener más variedades de animales.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de balanceados, con los cuales podrá seguir alimentando a sus animales y de esa forma evitar que le falte ese producto tan importante para su trabajo.
texts.en:
The committee  “29 de Septiembre" is currently in their third loan cycle, with 15 members.  They are glad to be working with the committee and feel thankful for the opportunity they are being given.

Mirna is the president of the group and says that she is involved in the growth and sales of animals.  She says that it's very hard work and she does it full time, since she has to be waiting on her animals 24 hours a day.  Her goal is to have a big farm where she would be able to keep a greater variety of animals.

She is asking for a loan to buy balanced feed, with which she will be able to continue feeding her animal and to avoid running out of such an important product for her business.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for animals.

loans.name: Christian Geral

texts.es:
Christian es un joven de 20 años, es soltero, vive con sus padres y hermanos en la ciudad de Chincha,  a pesar de su corta edad él es muy trabajador, amable y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar y solventar sus gastos no ha podido estudiar una carrera profesional, pero sueña con poder hacerlo pronto, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y hermanos, y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia. 
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, desde hace 2 años, día a día Christian trabaja como obrero en un taller de confecciones de jaulas para aves, él trabaja un aproximado de 10 horas diarias y se siente a gusto realizando su labor ya que sus jefes lo consideran mucho por su buen desempeño y por su trato amable hacia los demás.
Christian se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea poder hacer el tarrajeo, pintado y puesta de falso piso de su habitación; de esta manera Christian contará con un ambiente adecuado y más seguro, el cual brinde las condiciones necesarias para su mejor desarrollo, así él espera poder seguir trabajando y luchando para salir adelante junto con su familia.
texts.en:
Christian is 20 years old and is single.  He lives with his parents and his brothers in the city of Chincha.  In spite of his young age he is very hardworking, friendly and enthusiastic.  He his highly motivated to get ahead.  Regrettably, due to the necessity of working and covering his expenses he has not been able to study for a professional career, but he dreams of being able to do this soon.  In his spare time he likes to play soccer with his friends and brothers, and sometimes he makes the rich local dish Carapulcra con Sopa Seca to share with his family.

With a great deal of diligence and enthusiasm, for the last two years he has worked in a shop that makes bird cages.  He works approximately 10 hours every day and enjoys his work.  His bosses hold him in high regard for his diligence and his friendly treatment of others.

Christian is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help he will be able to make improvements to his house.  He wants to seal his walls, paint them and install a false ceiling in his room.  In this way he will have a more secure and comfortable environment.  This will in turn provide the necessary conditions so that he can continue working and fighting to get ahead with his family.

loans.use: to make improvements to his home.

loans.name: Micaela

texts.es:
Micaela es casada y tiene tres hijos que están en etapa escolar viven en casa propia y solo ocupan una habitación pequeña con paredes de ladrillo y el piso de tierra , la casa esta ubicada en la zona Bautista Saavedra de la ciudad de El Alto.
Ella estudio solo hasta la primaria y actualmente percibe ingresos ya que trabaja por más de doce horas elaborando mantas para posteriormente venderlas en una tienda que tiene en su domicilio, también vende chuño ya que debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para aumentar su capital, desea comprar el material para la elaboración de mantas ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza y desea aumentar sus ingresos.
El sueño de Micaela, es  construir más habitaciones ya que desea dar más comodidad a su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la cuarta vez que solicita el crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Micaela’s married and has three children who are school age.  They live in a house of their own occupying a single room with brick walls and dirt floor located in the city of El Alto’s Bautista Saavedra zone.

She only went to elementary school and currently earns income working more than 12 hours making blankets to then sell in a store she has at home.  She also sells dehydrated potato because she has to cover food, schooling and basic utility costs for her family.

The loan she needs is to increase capital.  She wants to buy materials needed to make blankets because what she earns is insufficient and she wants to increase her income.

Micaela’s dream is to build more rooms to provide more comfort for her family and to improve their quality of life.

This is her fourth loan request to IMPRO and first with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy blanket-making supplies.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
Reyna, tiene 35 años de edad, vive en la aldea La Esperanza es una comunidad rural del departamento de Colon. Ella es casada, pero su esposo vive fuera del país. Tienen 2 hijos que están estudiando. 

Su actividad económica que le genera ingresos es una pequeña pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica (manteca, cereal, arroz, sopas, kétchup, papel higiénico, salsas, frijoles, sal, etc. y algunos productos de achinería.

Este negocio lo inicio desde el año 2008, trabajando muy duro todo el día, lo que ha permitido que su inventario crezca y sus ventas.

El año pasado solicito un préstamo de L.5,000.00 con el cual incremento el inventario, ya su negocio esta mas surtido y está obteniendo más ingresos para el hogar y los gastos de sus hijos.
Actualmente solicita el segundo préstamo a ODEF y a KIVA por 7,000 Lempiras para surtir mas el negocio pues su sueño es llegar poco a poco a convertirse en un mini súper, y así sus ingresos serán mejores.
texts.en:
Reyna, age 35, lives in the La Esperanza village. This is a rural community in the Colon department. She is married, but her husband lives outside of the country. She has two children, and they both go to school.

The financial activity that generates income for her is a small grocery store. That is where she sells everyday food products (butter, grains, rice, soup, ketchup, toilet paper, salsas, beans, and salt, etc. and some novelty products). 

She has had her business since 2008, and she works very hard all day.  This has allowed her inventory and her sales to increase.  Last year she requested a loan for 5,000 lempiras, which she used to increase her inventory.  Now her business is stocked more, and she is getting more income for the household and her children’s expenses.

She is currently requesting her second loan from ODEF and Kiva for 7,000 lempiras.  She will use the loan to stock her business more.  Her dream is for her business is to, little by little, become a mini supermarket.  That way her income will be better.

loans.use: to stock her business with food products.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.es: La Sra. Catherine tiene 22 años y tiene un  hijo que tiene la edad de 4 años.  Ella se dedica a venta de sogas y pitas que mayormente lo utilizan en la construcción de viviendas para sujetar los materiales de construcción, tiene su puesto de venta  que se encuentran en la zona de la 16 de Julio  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Catherine va a usar este préstamo para la compra de motor para su  movilidad ya que le ayuda a transportar su mercadería hasta su puesto de venta y ahora que está mal el motor le perjudica de gran manera su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de efectivo, la Sra. va a utilizar los beneficios en capital de inversión su deseo es  mejorar su calidad de vida de ella y de toda su familia.
texts.en: Catherine is 22 years old and has a four year old son.  She sells rope and twine that is mainly used in construction to secure building materials.  Her sales stand is located in the “16 de Julio” zone.  This is her first loan with the institution.  Catherine is going to use the loan to purchase a motor for her vehicle. Now that the motor is defective, this greatly impairs her ability to do business because she uses the vehicle to transport merchandise to her sales stand.  She is requesting this loan because she does not have cash.  Catherine is going to use the proceeds to invest in working capital.  She wishes to improve her quality of life and that of her entire family.

loans.use: to purchase a motor for her vehicle.

loans.name: Jhona

texts.en:
Jhona is engaged in producing and selling dried fish from the town of Trinidad, Bohol.  She is married with two young children to support out of this livelihood. It is her dream that she can continue her business and even improve it for a bigger income.  

She is asking for a loan to buy more fresh fish to dry and sell to her customers. Her income will provide a nutritious diet for her family and this will also pay the family’s basic household needs like the electric bill and water. Any additional income will be reinvested for the same business and savings.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to dry and sell

loans.name: Thach's Group

texts.en:
Thach is 29 years old, married, and has two children who attend school.  She lives in a small thatched roof house in the Kang Meas district of Kampong Cham province, She has been in rice farming and cow raising for nine years and supplements the family’s income by selling grocery items. The current business earns her family about 30,000 KHR a day. A lack of water supply for her rice farming is the main challenge for her business.

Thach’s group consists of two members who have received loans from VisionFund for one cycle. Thach has successfully repaid her past loan, which has helped her augment her business activities and support children’s education. Thach, who is the group leader, and her member are requestingr a loan from VisionFund for 1,000,000 KHR each. She will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and a cow for raising to support her farming. She hopes this loan will enable her to make her business more viable and profitable so as to better off her family's living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her farmland and a cow

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Sinai's Group

texts.en:
Sinai is 23 years old and a young married mother with one daughter who is still dependent on her. She lives with her husband in a rural area of the Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district of Cambodia. For the past five years, Sinai has worked as a farmer and also earns additional income by working for others for a fee. She is able to earn about 15,000 KHR per day to provide for her family. 

Sinai's group consists of three female members who live in the same village. She is the leader of this group that is requesting its first micro loan with VisionFund. Sinai is going to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farm. She hopes that she will be able to improve her standard of living and live happily.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is 31 years old and is engaged in a sari-sari (variety) store business for her income.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy stock of rice and feed that she can sell in her store. These are the types of merchandise bought by her customers in a daily basis.

Gloria dreams of improving her business so that she can have an increased profit that will allow her to help her family. Any additional income will be used for  family daily consumption, reinvestment of the same business, and savings.

loans.use: to buy rice and feed.

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Annaliza has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for 4 years.

She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Annaliza has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Saven's Group

texts.en:
Saven, a 25-year-old married woman, resides in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She has two sons, both of whom are still dependent on her. The main source of her family's income is from cassava planting on one hectare of farmland, which she has been doing for several years to make a living. She can earn approximately 20,000 Cambodia Riels (KHR) per day and she manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. The low price of cassava output is the main challenge for her business.

This is the second loan for Saven and one other member with VisionFund, while the other one is just starting with VisionFund. The past loan has helped Saven cater her family with sufficient foods. She is leading her group of three to apply for a loan. As the leader, Saven will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to pay for labor costs. She hopes to increase her crop yields so as to earn more income to improve her family's standard of living and also build some savings for her children in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James has been selling home products such as perfumes, utensils, and basins for the past 4 years. He sells at the market in an open air. James is 32, and he is married with a 2-year-old son. His wife Nadzua works as a tailor. 

James is an aggressive person who finds ways to progress in life. He is asking for this loan in order to buy more stock of household items such as glasses, cups, and jugs in order to provide a greater variety of products in his business. This will improve his customer service.

In the future, James hopes to expand his merchandise so as to sale more products. He also aims at establishing a store to stock his inventory.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household items such as glasses, cups, and jugs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 26-year-old single man and has been the owner of an internet cafe for three years with four years of experience in this field.  

Most of Mohamad's clients are villagers.  They enjoy spending their time in his shop since he is almost the same age and holds competitions on a certain game which increases enthusiasm among them.  Small children also come to play games suitable for their age, which he recommends to them.  

Because such a business recommends a lot of new releases, Mohamad is requesting a YOUTH LOAN from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy a new PlayStation, an LCD screen and a power generator to make sure that electricity is available all the time for his customers' benefit. 

Mohamad hopes to continue expanding  his business in the future by establishing several departments, each one targeting a certain age and needs, and he is doing just that, but gradually through Al Majmoua loans. Note that this is Mohamad's second loan from Al Majmoua, and through his previous loan, he bought a PlayStation, new game releases, computers and UPS necessary to back up information when the power cuts off suddenly.

loans.use: to buy a PlayStation, an LCD screen, and a power generator necessary for his business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 38 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala South region of Uganda. She is single and has 3 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 2 years, Esther has been working hard to manage her restaurant, where she makes traditional Ugandan cuisine. 

To help expand her business, Esther has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy saucepans and tables, and will help Esther to generate greater profits and increase the amount of food she can make. Esther hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a bigger restaurant. 

Esther is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Esther who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy saucepans and tables

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is 36 years old and married with 3 children, ages 5 years and 15 years old. She runs a firewood business within a busy market area in Kulanda town Southern area in Bo, Sierra Leone.

She's been in this business for 10 years and sells firewood. She also earns income from small-scale farming. She says that the main challenge to her business, transporting the firewood from villages to town, is very difficult.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more firewood. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to improve her standard of living.  In the future, she would like to have a house of her own. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more firewood

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
Rodolfo is 27 years old and is married with one child. He lives in the Philippines. For the past six years, Rodolfo has been raising ducks and chickens in his backyard. He has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.

Rodolfo is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to buy animal feed. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed

loans.name: Naseer

texts.en:
Naseer is a 43-year-old married man, father of four children, and he has worked as a mechanic for three years. Naseer is working hard to expand and improve his business as much as he can, that's why he applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to start a new business. He will invest in doing necessary maintenance to the courtyard in front of his garage to start car wash business, which will increase his income so it would definitely cover most of his family's expenses.

Naseer has a good reputation in his area, and is recommended by almost all of his customers.

loans.use: To open a new car wash business

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen  is a 43-year-old mother of two children ages 16 and 24. She is from Sikatuna, Bohol, Philippines. Currently, Belen operates a hog-raising business which is profitable and improving. She works hard in her business and hopes that it will help sustain her family and provide for their daily financial needs. 

Belen is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to buy additional piglets and pig feed. She is certain that her loan will allow her to buy what she needs for the growth and development of her business. Belen is looking for a better future and hopes that her business will turn into a higher-yielding investment. She plans to provide a better future for her children and save some money.

loans.use: to buy piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet 42-year-old Isatu from Kulanda town Southern area in Bo. She is married with 6 children between the ages of 13 years and 25 years. Three of her children are currently attending school. In 1995, Isatu established her dried fish business. She began her business because her parent taught her the business; her mother was once a fish seller. She works at the business 12 hours a day and 7 day per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is during rainy season when there is a scarcity of fish.

Isatu requires a loan in order to buy more dried fish. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to expand her business. In the future, Isatu plans to export fish. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish

loans.name: Mohsen

texts.en:
Mohsen is a 49-year-old married man, father of two children. Mohsen has been working for seven years in selling men's clothes, exactly since he opened his retail shop in 2005. Mohsen came back to Lebanon in 2005 and started his business because he likes this kind of work and wants to settle down.

Mohsen wants to get ready for the end of Ramadan month's celebrations, that's why he applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to  increase his business capital with a new summer collection.

This is his third cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower and he is always optimistic with these loans, that's why he is loyal to Al Majmoua and always does his best to pay on time and show his good standing. He hopes to improve and expand his business more and more in the future.

loans.use: to increase his business capital with a new summer collection

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is a woman from  Trinidad, Bohol. She is married to a farmer and they have two children ages one and eight years old. They till their land and work hard so they can provide the needs of their family. She is asking for a loan to buy quality seedlings, fertilizer and pay for the labor of hired help during farm preparation. This will make Jocelyn’s farming business stay on the right footing.  Her income will be for family daily consumption and a healthy diet for her children.

loans.use: to buy quality seedlings, fertilizer and pay for the labor of hired help

loans.name: Yet's Group

texts.en:
Yet is 41 and the married mother of ten children. She lives in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Yet takes care of nine of her ten children (four daughters and five sons) as some are still attending school in the local area and some are helping with the family business. For the past 20 years, Yet and her husband have struggled to feed their big family by farming rice on a 1.5 hectare farm. They supplement their income by cultivating cassava on two hectares of farmland. Their current business earns Yet's family about 14,800 KHR per day.

Yet is the leader of a two-person group loan that is requesting a loan of 1,200,000 KHR for each member. She has been with VisionFund for one cycle and has fully repaid her previous loan. Yet will use her portion of the loan to pay for labor costs to transplant rice and to repair her tractor. She hopes that her loan will enable her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to pay labor costs to transplant rice and to repair her tractor

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en: Thomas is 39 years old, married and the father of three children. For the last 10 years he has earned a living as a farmer, and now has an income of KES 9,000 a month. He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD, for KES 25,000, to buy supplies for his farm, including fertilizer and pesticides, as well as pay for workers to help him. He expects to use the additional profits he earns to buy more acres of land for farming. His dream for the future is to have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farm.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha, age 48, lives with her husband and has four children. She has a business which generates an income to help support her household. She operates a poultry business, a business she has been in for 6 years and she sells the chickens at the market. Martha says that she sells her chickens mostly to cafe operators. She makes her purchases of chicks in cash, but some are on credit in rare cases. She is now applying for a Kiva loan with which she will buy more chicks and chicken feed. Her goal for the future is to have a retail shop, so that she can diversify her operations.

loans.use: to buy more chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Barbra

texts.en:
Barbra is 51 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala South region of Uganda. She is single and has 3 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 4 years, Barbra has been working hard to manage her general shop, where she sells eggs, rice, posho, bread and other food. 

To help expand her business, Barbra has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar, rice, flour, cooking oil and other food, and will help Barbra to generate greater profits and earn more income to cater for all basic necessities like education and health. Barbra hopes that in the future she will be able to build rental homes. 

Barbra is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Barbra who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, rice, flour, cooking oil and other food

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 39 years old and lives in the town of Abaita Ababiri in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is single and has 5 children with 4 of them currently in school. For the past 2 years, Grace has been working hard to manage her brick-selling business. 

To help expand her business, Grace has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sand to make bricks with, and will help Grace to generate greater profits and generate more income to be able to sustain her home. Grace hopes that in the future she will be able to increase the size of her brick business. 

Grace is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Grace who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more sand to make bricks with

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine lives in Bien Unido, Bohol with her family. She is married with a young child. She operates a sari-sari (variety) store while her husband works in the evening as a fisherman. In her store, Josephine sells basic household items like coffee, sugar, cooking oil, toiletries, spices, vinegar, soy sauce and canned goods. She also helps sell her husband's catch in the market. She is asking for a loan to purchase stocks of seasonings, toiletries, canned goods, rice and materials for house renovation like paint and hard wood. Josephine hopes for their businesses to continue to flourish, giving her the means to provide for her child.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of seasonings, toiletries, canned goods, rice and materials for house renovation

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is forty-two years old with three children. She has been running a clothing business for the last five years, earning a monthly income of KES 9,000. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES10,000 from KADET LTD, which she plans to use to purchase more stock of children's wear such as shorts, T-shirts and shirts for sale. 


She plans to use the anticipated profit to open another branch. Her future hope is to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase more  stock of children's wear such as shorts, T-shirts and shirts

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 43-year-old Fatamata from Kulanda town southern area in Bo. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 7 years and 25 years. Two of her children attend school. She began this business because of the situation of her parents.

Fatmata runs a food stand business; she sells palm oil, 'gari' (manioc couscous), and pineapples. She has been running this business for 30 years. She works at the business 12 hours a day and 7 days per week.  Her business is the only   source of income she has. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to operate the business.

Fatmata has requested a loan in order to buy more foodstuffs like palm oil, 'gari', and pineapples. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living. In the future, she plans to buy a television and expand her business more. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs like palm oil, 'gari', and pineapples.

loans.name: Hezron

texts.en:
Hezron is 38 years old, married to Rose and blessed with three children ages 14, 12 and 10 years, respectively. He runs a shop where he sells spices, a business he started 2 years ago, and earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES. 

He has requested a second loan of 50,000 KES to purchase more spices for sale. The profit he makes will be ploughed back to his business. His dream is to see his business grow bigger everyday.

loans.use: To purchase more food spices for sale.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Hannah from Kulanda town Southern area in Bo, Sierra Leone. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 4 years and 10 years old.

Hannah runs a clothing business; she sells cotton, shoes and bags. She has been running this business for 12 years. She works at the business 12 hours a day, 7 days per week. She also earns income from her husband who works as a driver. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

Hannah has requested a loan in order to buy more cotton, shoes and bags. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and educate her children. In the future, she plans to open a boutique. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more cotton, shoes and bags

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a 49-year-old married woman with two young children ages 8 and 7 years old. She  lives with her family in Bohol, Philippines. Julia hasbeen engaged in the farming business for more than five years now. Julia tills the land and grows rice with her family.
