Eilen's goal is to grow [her business] but he main challenge is not having enough capital to make an impact in the potential market [of her neighbourhood]. This is exactly why she wants a Kiva loan, this is her first loan with the "Mario Santo Domingo" foundation and with which she will buy miscellaneous shop items, ice cream products and snacks, sweets and industrially processed foods.

Her dream is to support her family more every time giving her children as much comfort as she can give them so they will be successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous shop items, ice cream and snacks, sweets and  industrially processed foods

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.ru:
Татьяне 50 лет. Она живет в небольшом городке Берегово, что в Западной Украине. Она работает бухгалтером в отделе образования. Ее все знают как пунктуального работника и ответственного человека. 

Татьяна давно мечтает о том, чтобы сделать ремонт в своем частном доме, а именно отремонтировать кухню и одну из 4-х комнат, чтобы условия проживания семьи стали немного уютнее. У Татьяны есть дочки, которые недавно вышли замуж и живут вместе с ней. В семье появляются внуки, и молодым семьям очень хочется уюта и удобства. Татьяна всегда жила своей семьей, она занимала в ее жизни первое место.
texts.en: Tatyana is 50 years old.  She lives in a small town of Beregovo, which is in Western Ukraine.  She works as an accountant an education department.  Everyone knows her as a punctual employee and a responsible person.  Tatyana has been long dreaming about making repairs in her own house, especially repairing the kitchen and one of the four rooms, in order to provide more comfortable living conditions for her family.  Tatyana has daughters, who recently got married and live with her.  The family is starting to have grandchildren, and young families want comfort and convenience.  Tatyana always lived through her family, which has been a first priority in her life.

loans.use: to make repairs in her own house, especially to repair the kitchen and one of the four rooms

loans.name: Mata De Palma En Desarrollo 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Carmen is the coordinator of the group Mata de Palma en Desarrollo ("Mata de Palma in development" called like this because this is the name of the community). The group is  is located, in Hato Mayor city, in the eastern part of the country. Hato Mayor is a fairly mountainous region where the principal industry is agriculture.

Carmen is a mother of four children and they live together with her and their father. She said that her most difficult challenge has been to create her business. In the past it was very difficult for her because she didn't have how to save a capital to start, but after she found Esperanza and took out her loans, she was able (like other members in this group) to open her business.

Carmen is excited about her 14th loan with Esperanza. After almost seven years in her business, she has expanded her little butcher shop into a bigger one, with more quantity of meats to supply more clients. With this loan she will buy beef and pork, to sell them in her business. She will use the profits to invest in her butcher shop and she will continuing saving part of it to make one of her dreams come true: to start building her house. She dreams of having a nice house and a successful business with employees. Carmen and her group thank all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy beef and pork

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a single woman. She has two children, ages 3 and 5 years. She describes herself to be an honest woman. 

She operates a retail store where she sells cosmetics, earrings, body oil, jewelry, perfumes, etc. She has been involved in this business for two years and employs one staff member. Her business is located within a viable business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a shortage of cosmetics for reselling. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more cosmetics. Her business goal is to run a similar retail store within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will build her own business premises.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Shanti

texts.en:
Shanti is 27 years old. She is married and has one child, aged 11. In 2003, she established her grocery store business. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 6 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her business.  In the future, Shanti plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods

loans.name: Gulzinat

texts.ru:
Гулзинат жительница Яванского района. Ей 32 года. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Гулзинат имеет среднее образование. Она занимается домашним хозяйством. Гулзинат живет вместе с родителями мужа. Ее муж и свекор находятся за рубежом на заработках. 
Гулзинат имеет одного теленка, которого она приобрела не давно для своей семьи (в будущем для получения молока и молочных продуктов). 
После отъезда мужа Гулзинат решила заняться скотоводством. Она просит кредит для закупа несколько голов бычков и одного теленка, чтобы начать свою деятельность.
texts.en: Gulzinat is a resident of the Yavan district.  She is 32 years old, married and has three children.  Gulzinat has a secondary education.  She is involved in household work.  Gulzinat lives together with her husband's parents.  Her husband and father-in-law work abroad.  Gulzinat has one calf, which she recently bought for her family (to get milk and milk products in the future).  Gulzinat decided to get involved in animal husbandry after her husband's departure.  She is requesting this loan to buy several bulls and one calf in order to start her business.

loans.use: to buy several bulls and one calf

loans.name: Al-Abeer Group

texts.en: This group, called Al-Abeer, consists of four ladies: Ahtram, Najiah, Alia and Abeer. They live in Sana`a, Yemen. Abeer, 18 years old and engaged, is a student and hardworking woman. She has applied for a youth loan of 50000 YER from AMB to buy a computer for personal use. She hopes to be a doctor.

loans.use: to buy a computer for personal use

loans.name: Malak Group

texts.en:
This group, called Malak, consists of three ladies, Badria, Najoa, and Saba, and one man, Mohammed. They live in Sana`a, Yemen.

Saba, a successful woman, is a 27-year-old housewife with three children. Good-natured and clever, she tries to do the best for her family. Saba is requesting a youth loan of 50000 YER from AMB to buy a washing machine for her home.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine for her house.

loans.name: Dhan Maya

texts.en:
Dhan Maya is 40 years old, married, and has two children.  In 2000, she established  her vegetable farming business.  Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family.  

Dhan Maya has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and will use her most recent loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.  In the future, Dhan Maya plans to raise the economic condition of her family.    

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Mark

texts.en: This is 44-year-old Mark. He is married, and has 4 children aged 3, 6, 8 and 13. He has 2 additional dependents, who live with him so he can assist a brother with his children's education. In 1997, Mark established his used clothing business. The business started to be able to cater to the needs of the family. Working 6 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 2,535,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. Mark has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to increase his stock of used trousers. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 557,700. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy men's trousers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tea tree seedlings.

loans.name: Batbayar

texts.en:
Mr. Batbayar, aged 36, lives with his wife and two children in an apartment in Ulaanbaatar. His son goes secondary school and his daughter goes to a kindergarten. In 2009, he started up a grocery business  with his wife, named Odgerel, in a 'ger' district of Ulaanbaatar. They are experienced enough to conduct the grocery business. Their monthly profit is  approximately 1,000,000-1,500,000  MNT. Before this, they got loans ranging from 1,500,000-4,800,000 MNT and had been repaying their debt on time.  The previous loans were used to decorate and restore their apartment and buy furniture. 

Mr. Batbayar is requesting a 5,000,000 MNT loan  to buy a car for shipping.

loans.use: to buy a car for shipping goods

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
La socia Patricia continua con su negocio de venta de artesania ,la socia vende diferentes tipos de colores de tejidos,ella compra y tambien elabora algunos tejidos,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le trae satisfaciones tanto economicas como personales ya que mediante este trabajo ella puede conocer a personas de diferentes nacionalidades,siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de hilos y lana para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: Patricia continues selling artisanal crafts made of woven cloth in various colours, which she buys or makes. She has been in this line of business for quite some time and says it brings her both personal and financial satisfaction. Indeed, through her work she gets to meet people of various nationalities, and it is thus that she makes her family prosper. She asks for this loan in order to buy thread and wool for her business. She is grateful for the loan and promises to be punctual in her repayments.

loans.use: to buy wool and thread for her business.

loans.name: Adris

texts.en:
Adris, a 29-year-old married father of one, lives in Sana`a, Yemen where he is a hardworking sewer. He has striven with great courage in order to provide for his family, laboring very hard so that his child can become a professional.

Working daily in his sewing shop, Adris, who creates and sells clothes to his clients, loves what he does. He has applied for a youth loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy an additional sewing machine and sewing materials for his business.

loans.use: to buy an additional sewing machine and sewing materials for his business.

loans.name: Abdulai

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Abdulai.  He is married and has three children, aged 2, 5, and 10. He has one additional dependent who lives with him to help a younger brother with his education. 

In 2001, Abdulai established his cow meat business. He began his business after coming from the village to stay with a brother and to be self-reliant. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le, 765,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Abdulai has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more cow meat. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 221,200. 

In the future, Abdulai plans to increase the number of beef stands.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for cow meat.

loans.name: Clyde

texts.en: Clyde is a 30-year-old member.  He is single, and a resident of Poblacion, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor.  He engages in selling toasted and steamed peanuts with an average monthly income of PHP 2,000.  He has operated the business for 5 years.  Now he is seeking another loan from PMPC to acquire more stocks of peanuts for sale.  He is hoping to improve his life in preparation for his future family.

loans.use: to acquire more stocks of peanuts for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for cooking condiments.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is twenty-five years old, married to Samuel, and they are blessed  with two children. She has been a hawker for the last two years, earning a monthly income of KES 13,600.

She has applied for her second loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD, which she plans to use to purchase stock of biscuits, bread and wheat flour.

The anticipated profits will be invested back into her business. Her future dreams are to have a happy family and buy a plot of land to construct residential houses to rent out.

loans.use: to purchase  biscuits, bread and wheat flour for sale.

loans.name: 74-La Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento 74-LA NUEVA ESPERANZAEstá  compuesto por ocho integrantes seis mujeres y dos varones,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Fabiola tiene 40 años, y tiene dos hijos de las edades de 5, 7 años,  La Sra. Fabiola  se dedica  a la actividad de venta de calzados, tiene su puesto de venta que  encuentra ubicado en la localidad de Nueva Esperanza,   este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Fabiola va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de calzados por mayor   y así de esta manera brindar variedad de sus productos  a  sus clientes e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Fabiola va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de productos, la Sra. fabiola  es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en: Communal bank 74-La Nueva Esperanza is made of eight people: six women and two men. Fabiola is the president; she is forty years old and has two children aged five and seven. She sells shoes from her stall located in Nueva Esperanza. This loan is her first cycle with the field partner. Fabiola will use the funds to buy shoes wholesale and thus be able to offer a wider range of products to her customers and improve her earnings. She wants to improve her business. She will use the profits to keep buying a greater variety of shoes. Fabiola is very hardworking and is happy for the opportunity afforded to her and her fellow group members, since some of them are the sole breadwinners in their respective households.

loans.use: to buy shoes wholesale.

loans.name: Las Ovejitas 1 Group

texts.en:
Jesucita is the coordinator of her group, Las Ovejitas 1 (The little lambs), and her story is typical of her group members and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. The group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo, an area where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. Jesucita is the mother of three children and makes her home here in a simple structure with her children and her long-term partner.

Jesucita is excited to be taking out her ninth loan with Esperanza and at the opportunity to grow her business with capital at low interest. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business, a little restaurant called Comedor where she prepares lunch for people in her community. Jesucita will purchase goods for cooking such as rice, beans, meat, and cooking oil, as well as disposables to serve at lunch. She will use the profits to invest in her business and to provide little by little for the needs of her family. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, meat, disposables, etc.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
As a married parent of 3 children, Jean works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Jean is borrowing PHP 40000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

Jean has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 43 years old and single.

Lourdes works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Lourdes has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell charcoal business for 10 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Lourdes aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Union De Mujeres De Desarrollo Group

texts.en:
Julia is the coordinator of her group, Union De Mujeres En Desarrollo, which is composed of 20 women entrepreneurs and located in the city of San Pedro de Macoris. Their community is a rural area surrounded by fields of sugarcane. 

Julia has operated a business selling groceries and food. She runs a colmado, a small grocery store where she sells goods or different food like supermarkets. She will use her loan to increase her inventory by buying rice, sugar, beans, cooking oil, canned food, flour, and other goods.

Julia and her husband live together with their three children. Her most important challenges are to work hard to gain extra income and to better her home structure together with her husband and older son incoming. 

She is receiving her seventh loan from Esperanza Internacional. Because her loan repayments have all been made punctually, she has been able to grow her business with the reinvestment she makes from each loan. 

Julia would like to save her profits to finish building her house.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, cooking oil, canned food, flour, and other goods.

loans.name: Sueño Del Futuro Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento SUEÑO DEL FUTURO Está  compuesto por ocho integrantes seis mujeres y dos varones,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Martha tiene 56 años, y tiene tres hijos de las edades de 13, 16 y 18 años,  La Sra. Martha se dedica  a la actividad de elaboración y  venta de pan, tiene su panadería que se encuentra ubicado en la localidad de Nueva Esperanza,   este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Martha va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de un horno de panadería industrial  y así de esta manera brindar un mejor servicio a  sus clientes e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Martha va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando utensilios e insumos para la elaboración de sus panes, la Sra. Martha  es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en: The communal bank SUEÑO DEL FUTURO is made up of eight members – six women and two men. The bank is coordinated by Martha, a 56-year-old woman with three children aged 13, 16 and 18. Martha bakes and sells bread for a living. She has her own bakery, which is situated in the town of Nueva Esperanza. This will be the first loan cycle she has taken part in with the group. Martha plans to use this loan to purchase an industrial bread oven, which will allow her to provide a better service to her customers and increase her profits. She decided to apply for the loan because she wants to keep improving her business. She plans to use her profits to keep buying bread-making utensils and ingredients. Martha is very hard-working and is grateful for the opportunity that she and her fellow group members have been given, since some of them are single parents.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial bread oven.

loans.name: Teresa Gerarda

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Teresa, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen Asunta de Racsa” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. Nuestra socia se sigue dedicando al comercio de papas al por mayor y menor, trabajo que viene realizando al igual que su hermana, pero de forma independiente hace algunos  años,  actividad que  ha podido levantar y desarrollar para beneficio integral de su familia. Teresa realiza este trabajo durante todo el día, desde muy temprano en la madrugada al momento de recibir el producto de los productores, hasta horas de la noche que los clientes van a realizar compras. Nuestra socia provee de este tubérculo a diferentes mercados como son los hoteles, restaurantes, supermercados y también vende directamente al por menor.  Nuestra socia en esta oportunidad invertirá su préstamo para capitalizar su actividad y comprará diferentes especies de papas al por mayor, para cubrir su mercado y demanda.
Teresa está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle mantenerse con su actividad y llevar el sustento a sus hijos y a su casa.
texts.en:
This is our member, Teresa.  She belongs to the Virgen Asunta de Rasca Communal Bank from the city of Cusco, Peru.  She still sells potatoes wholesale and retail for a living, which she does alongside her sister.  However, she has been working independently for a few years now and she has been able to advance and develop this business to the great benefit of her family.  Teresa does this work all day, from very early in the morning when she receives her produce from the producers, until nighttime when her customers do their shopping.  She supplies this tuber to different markets, such as hotels, restaurants, and supermarkets, and she also sells them directly retail.  This time, our member will use her loan to capitalize her business and she will buy different types of potatoes wholesale in order to cover her market and her demand.  

Teresa is very thankful to Kiva for allowing her to maintain her business and support her children and her home.

loans.use: to buy potatoes wholesale

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi is a resident of Kongowea area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has four children, of whom three attend school. She owns a charcoal business which has been in operation for the last six years. Apart from this business, she earns a salary from the family’s transport business that she operates.

Mwanahamisi learned about Milango through a friend and joined the organization with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenges are transport costs.

Mwanahamisi is applying for a loan of 32,550 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stock of charcoal. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve the living standard of her family. She aspires to be a wholesaler of charcoal.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina lives in Kongowea area of Coast province. She is married and has five school going children. Georgina owns a retail shop for selling cooking oil, flour, wheat, kerosene, etc. that she has been running for six years. Apart from this, she gets her salary from her teaching profession.

Georgina learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operation of the business. The challenges she is facing are price fluctuation and inflation.

Georgina is applying for a loan of 21,950 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stock of kerosene, cooking oil, flour, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to savings to pay school fees and to improve on the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of kerosene, cooking oil, flour, etc.

loans.name: Plan De Lucha 2 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Claritza is one of the members of the Plan de Lucha (Battle Plan) Group 2 & 5, located in the city of Hato Mayor, a mainly agricultural region. It is one of the most rural cities in the Dominican Republic.

Claritza, the mother of two children who live with her and her long-term partner, has been selling underwear for about four-and-a-half years. She started it with her initiative and a small amount of savings to generate income and be useful. She tells us that her biggest challenge has been working to help her children get ahead. Her favorite activity is tending to her business.

Having repaid her previous loan, Claritza is very excited to receive her sixth loan through Esperanza Internacional, another step toward making her business grow. She plans to invest this new loan by purchasing underwear for men and women; she intends to start selling them in wholesale quantities. Claritza will reinvest her earnings in the business and save for the future. Her dream is to have a well-established enterprise, and she thanks all of you for your support!!!

loans.use: to buy underwear for her business.

loans.name: Ma. Lina

texts.en:
Ma. Lina is 48 years old and married. She has 2 children.

Ma. Lina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Ma. Lina has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell charcoal business for 7 years and also earns an income from direct selling of Avon products.

Ma. Lina aspires to save money so that she can afford to have her two children finish college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Unidas Para El Futuro 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Rafaela is the coordinator of her group, Unidas para el Futuro (United for the Future) 1, 2 & 3, and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally — many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the slums, north of the capital. She lives in a simple structure home with her four children and her long term partner. She has had her business for around 5 years, which she started after she need to find money for her home needs, because her partner's incoming funds were too slow. 

Rafaela is excited to be taking out her 4th loan with Esperanza to invest in her business, a Beauty Salon where she also sells underwear and miscellaneous products. She will use the profits to save towards owning her own home and helping her children to get a good education. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy hair and beauty products and underwear.

loans.name: Aurina

texts.en:
Aurina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bakery business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her bakery business.

Aurina has been in this business for 6 years. Aurina earns more income from buying and selling rice and raising pigs.

Aurina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Henry Malyori

texts.es:
Henry, tiene 29 años de edad, vive con sus padres y se dedica a cultivar maíz, desde pequeño está realizando este trabajo ya que su padre se lo inculcó.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de cinco sacos de abono dentro de ellos tres de sulfato y dos de fórmula, con este crédito el podrá invertir en los materiales para aplicar a los granos básicos y así protegerlos de la maleza y de las plagas, con el objetivo de aumentar su producción.

Su aspiracion es poder ayudar a sus padres con los cultivos, comercializando la cosecha, espera poder ir mejorando su trabajo en la agricultura.
texts.en:
Henry is 29, lives with his parents and works growing corn. He's been working in this job since he was little because his father taught him.

He wants a loan to buy five sacks of fertilizer, three of then sulfate and the other 2 formulated fertilizers; With his credit he will be able to invest in the materials to apply to the basic grains to protect them from weeds and plagues and thus increasing his production.

His goal is to help his parents with the crops, commercializing the harvest; he hopes to improve his work in agriculture.

loans.use: to buy five sacks of fertilizer [three of sulfate, two of formulated fertilizer]

loans.name: Glendis Zenaida

texts.es:
Glendis, tiene 22 años de edad, tiene una hija de 3 años de edad, vive en una aldea rural del municipio de Tocoa, Departamento de Colon, junto a sus padres y su hija. Su esposo vive fuera del país.
Glendis hace 10 meses decidió establecer su propia fuente de ingresos, donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como granos básicos, manteca, harina, sal, pastillas, enlatados, papel higiénico etc. anteriormente ella trabajaba en un comedor y no le dedicaba tiempo a su hija, ahora con este negocio pasa más con ella y su familia. Ha solicitado dos préstamos anteriores a ODEF para mantener productos para la venta. Este negocio es su fuente de ingresos donde cubre los gastos del hogar. Actualmente solicita un tercer préstamo, este es por 15,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar productos comestibles para surtir la pulpería.  Su meta es seguir creciendo para obtener mejores utilidades y juntamente con la ayuda de su esposo quiere construir su propia vivienda.
texts.en:
Glendis, 22, has a three-year-old daughter and lives in a rural village in the municipality of Tocoa, Colon Department with her parents and daughter.  Her husband lives abroad.

Glendis decided to start her own source of income ten months ago.  She sells basic staple items like basic grains, lard, flour, salt, pills, canned goods, toilet paper, etc.  She used to work in a cafeteria but wasn’t able to spend time with her daughter.  Now with this business she’s able to spend more time with her and her family.  

She’s asked ODEF for two previous loans to keep her store stocked.  This store is her source of income to cover household expenses.  

She’s currently asking for her third loan for 15,000 lempiras to buy food items for her store.  Her goal is to continue growing to obtain better profits and with help from her husband wants to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy food items for her store.

loans.name: Roxana Cristel

texts.es:
Roxana, quiere continuar invirtiendo en su negocio, mejorando la granja y al mismo tiempo está iniciando la siembra de granos básicos para lo cual invertirá una parte de este préstamo, su intención es adquirir pollos pequeños y concentrado, también comprarse el abono y los herbicidas necesarias para el cultivo de maíz, esto le ayudará para poder realizar dos actividades de las cuales puede obtener ganancias.

Con el préstamo anterior logró tener un efecto positivo que ha mejorado su granja con más pollos y al mismo tiempo ha aumentado la superficie donde los guarda, también sus cultivos de maíz le ayuda con el alimento para su familia.
texts.en:
Roxana wants to continue to invest in her business by improving her farm and, at the same time, she is starting to plant staple grains, for which she will use part of her loan.  Her intent is to buy small chickens and feed, as well as buying fertilizer and the herbicides she needs to grow corn.  This will help her be able to have two business from which she can generate income.

With her previous loan, she was able to make positive changes by improving her farm with more chickens and she was also able to expand the area where she keeps them.  Her corn crops will also help her to feed her family.

loans.use: to buy small chickens and feed, fertilizer and herbicides

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El socio Miguel continua dedicandose al negocio de tienda de abarrotes,el socio tiene su negocio por el centro de la ciudad y vende a sus clientes que le solicitan,el socio lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio cada dia ,el socio vende lo que son gaseosas,aceite,productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche tambien vende golosinas entre otros,siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.

El socio solicita el credito para la compra de mercaderia para su negocio como arroz y aceite.
El socio se siente agradecido por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas estbalecidas.
texts.en:
Migual continues with his grocery store.  He has his business located downtown and sells what his customers require.  He’s been in business for some time now and does well thanks to the effort he puts into it every day.  He sells such things as soft-drinks and basic staple items like rice, sugar and milk; he also sells snacks, among others.  This is how he supports his family.

He requests the loan to buy merchandise like rice and oil for his store.  He’s grateful for the loan granted and commits to make his installment payments.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Sabr-Almukala Group

texts.en: There are six women members of the group, "Sabr Almukala". They live in Hadramout, Yemen. Roza is the leader of group and has a tailoring business. She is a 23-year-old married woman and has one child. While running the business is difficult, she has been able to make a sufficient profit which has helped her take care of her needs and the needs of her child. She is requesting a youth loan of 30,000 Yemeni Rial (YER) to buy a sewing machine for her business.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her business.

loans.name: Cayetana

texts.es:
La señora Cayetana tiene 59 años de edad, es casada y fruto de esta relación tiene tres hijos, ella nació y vive en la ciudad de Oropesa a 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. Su actividad económica principal de la socia es la elaboración de pan. Ya son 17 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. 

La señora Cayetana es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que le invitaron a participar del banco Comunal “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” de la Asociación Arariwa. En esta oportunidad la señora Cayetana requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo sacos de azúcar, sacos de harina y otras cosas más. 

La señora Cayetana agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Cayetana, 59, is married and has three children.  She was born in and still lives in the city of Oropesa thirty minutes from the city of Cusco.  Her main economic activity is baking bread.  She’s been in this business 17 years and does very well.

Cayetana is an enterprising, hardworking woman who was invited to participate in Asociación Arariwa’s “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” communal bank.  On this occasion, Cayetana needs the loan to buy supplies like sacks of sugar, sacks of flour and other things.  Cayetana is grateful for the loan and commits to make her installment payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Gita

texts.en:
Gita is 23 years-old.  She is married and has 3 children, aged 20, 18 and 10.  In 2000, she established her grocery store business. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family. 

Gita has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, Gita plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods.

loans.name: Sarita

texts.en:
Sarita is 46 years-old . She is married and has 2 children, aged 22 and 20. In 2000, she established her vegetable farming business business. Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family.  

Sarita has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy seeds and fertilizers. In the future, Sarita plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 33 years old, single and a mother of two children, aged eight and four years old. She owns a boutique, a business she started six years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 60,000. She has requested a first loan of KES 30,000 to purchase  more trouser suits and shoes for ladies. 


The anticipated profit will aid her to buy additional stock for her business. Her dream is to one day purchase a plot of land and build rental houses for increased income as well as educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase  more trouser suits and shoes for ladies.

loans.name: Phineas

texts.en:
Phineas is a farmer in Nkubu, Central Kenya. He is the father of two children ages 10 and 3. He has been actively farming for six years and has one farmhand helping on his farms. He produces milk and vegetables. He also operates a taxi business.

Phineas has requested a loan of 52,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. His plan is to have a farm of at least three good-quality dairy cows. He believes farming will help him educate his children and give his family better living standards.

Phineas mentions poor rains and undeveloped local markets as his main business challenges.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Bianca

texts.en:
Bianca is 30 years old. She is friendly and very hardworking. She is a single mother to her three-year-old daughter whom she says is her pride and joy. She runs her own Mobile money transfers shop in a small town called Kapiri Mposhi located in Central Zambia. 

Her business is Mobile money transfers: people go to her shop to send and receive money to and from their families and friends throughout the country. Bianca's days are spent serving customers and running up and down to the bank so that she can satisfy her customers. She has employed one person to help her at her shop and so when she is at the bank, her teller remains at the shop, serving customers. 

Bianca started running this shop six months ago. Business is good and she says the one thing holding her back is that she does not have enough working capital to serve her customers at the desired time. She says this makes her panic sometimes because she constantly has to run up and down trying to find some money. This situation becomes worse when the bank closes because she cannot send the little working capitol that she has to the bank to convert it to cash. 

Bianca is taking out this loan so that she can increase her working capital and serve more customers. Serving more customers will mean she will be able to earn more profits. She is very excited about the future. 

In the video, a representative from Mobile transactions interviews Bianca.

loans.use: To increase her working capital so that she can serve more customers

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
La socia se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa y zapatos,la socia tambien trabajo como profesora cesante,el negocio de venta de zapatos y ropa lo realiza en forma independiente llevando a diferentes lugares como instituciones y a sus amigas, a veces la socia tiene dificultad en pagar la ropa o zapatos porque ella da a credito la  mercaderia a sus clientes,el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda donde pueda vender los zapatos y ropa.La socia solicita el credito para comprar polos,chompas y pantalones y tambien para comprar zapatos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Lourdes sells clothes and shoes and is also a retired teacher.  She sells the shoes and clothes independently taking them to various places like institutions and to her girlfriends.  Sometimes she has trouble paying for clothes or shoes because she sells on credit.  Her dream is to have a store in which to sell clothes and shoes.  She’s asking for the loan to buy shirts, sweaters and pants and also to buy shoes.  She is happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Elena, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen Asunta de Racsa” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. Nuestra socia se sigue dedicando al comercio de papas al por mayor y menor, trabajo que viene realizando hace algunos  años,  Elena realiza este sacrificado  trabajo durante todo el día, desde muy temprano en la madrugada al momento de recibir la mercadería de los productores, hasta horas de la noche que termina el movimiento comercial. Elena se sacrifica por su familia, para ofrecerle mejor edicacion a sus hijos, inversión que ella considera que es  lo más importante.
 Nuestra socia en esta oportunidad invertirá su préstamo para capitalizar su actividad y comprará diferentes especies de papas al por mayor, para cubrir su mercado y demanda.
Elena está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle mantenerse con su actividad, llevar el sustento a su casa y proporcionarles una mejor educación a sus hijos que es el gran sueño de Elena, sacarlos profesionales .
texts.en:
Elena belongs to the “Virgen Asunta de Racsa” communal bank in the city of Cusco, Perú.  She continues working as a retail and wholesale potato merchant, work she’s been carrying out for several years.  Elena does this demanding work all day starting in the early dawn hours when she receives her merchandise from producers until late at night when commercial activity ceases.  Elena sacrifices for her family in order to offer her children a better education, an investment she considers to be the most important one.

On this occasion she will use the loan to capitalize her activity buying different species of potatoes at wholesale to cover her market and demand.  Elena is very grateful to KIVA for making it possible for her to stay in business and provide sustenance for her home and to give her children a better education which is Elena’s great dream: to see them become professionals.

loans.use: to buy various species of potatoes at wholesale.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 59 years old and is a widow with five children.  She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines.   Lolita has been farming vegetables for 10 years and also earns additional income from a general store and a chicken retail business.

Lolita is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home and save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy fertilizers and farm supplies

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka is a resident of Nkubu in Central Kenya where she has been in active farming for four consecutive years.  She currently runs her farm with the help of one farmhand.  Milka is married and has one child, aged four. Her farm produce includes milk and vegetables which she sells to the local market to meet her family's basic needs.

Milka has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds. She says this will boost her farming income.  She hopes to buy more land to continue with her farming business expansion. Her focus is to improve her family's living standards.

Milka mentions poor rains and local markets as her main challenges.

loans.use: buy poultry birds

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La Sra. Juana de 69 años de edad es casada y no tiene dependientes económicos. Ella y su esposo son pensionados. Juana y su esposo están terminando de construir su casa ya que quieren un mejor patrimonio para ellos y para sus nietos cuando los van a visitar en esta ocasión ella pide de nuestra ayuda para construir un baño de block porque quiere mejorar su calidad de vida, ofreciéndole a su esposo y nietos un lugar mas apropiado. Ella agradecerá cualquier ayuda que se pueda brindar.
texts.en:
Juana, age 69, is married, and she does not have any dependents.  She and her husband are retirees.  Juana and her husband are finishing building their house.  They are doing this because they want a better property for themselves and for their grandchildren when they visit.

This time she is asking for our help to build a bathroom from cinder blocks.  She wants to do this because she wants to improve her quality of life.  She also wants to provide her husband and grandchildren with a more suitable place.  

She is grateful for whatever help that can be given.

loans.use: to build a bathroom from cinder blocks.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Rafael, vive en casa familiar junto con su madre y un hermano, no tiene hijos, administra un molino en la vivienda lo trabaja desde las cinco de la mañana hasta las cuatro de la tarde, esto lo aprendió con un amigo y tiene seis años de estar realizandolo,  sus clientes son personas del lugar.

Él solicita un préstamo para comprar materiales para la reparación de la base donde instala el molino, ya que ha comprado un nuevo molino y necesita fortalecer la base y al mismo tiempo comprarse fajas, discos, que son los necesarios para que pueda funcionar su nueva herramienta.
Su aspiración es poder mejorar el servicio a los clientes,  poder apoyar a su madre y sus hermanos con las ganancias que se puedan obtener del negocio.
texts.en:
Rafael lives in his family home along with his mother and a brother.  He does not have children.  He runs a mill in his home that he operates from five in the morning until four in the afternoon.  He learned how to do this with a friend and he has been doing it for six years.  His customers are people from the area.

He is asking for a loan to buy materials to repair the foundation where he set up his mill, as he bought a new mill and he needs to strengthen the foundation.  He also needs to buy belts and discs, which his new tool needs to function.

His goal is to be able to improve the service he offers his customers and to be able to support his mother and his siblings with the income they can get from his business.

loans.use: to buy belts and discs

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en:
Rahab is a farmer and a mother of three children who are all adults. She has had over twenty years in active farming within her rural home area. Her produce, which currently includes French peas and potatoes, are all sold within the local markets.

Rahab has made a loan request of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a water tank and irrigation pipes. She says the purchase of irrigation equipment and installation will help her farm run on and off season and generate her income which she intends to use in buying more land for a tea plantation.  Her emphasis is on capital which she ranks as the greatest challenge in farming.

loans.use: buy irrigation equipment

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erickis is aged 29 and married with one child, aged three. He has three successive years in farming with maize, milk and vegetables being the main produce which provide him with income for his family upkeep.

Erick has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help him buy barbed wire for putting up a zero grazing unit for his dairy farming. He says this will help in managing the feeding of his dairy cows, which is always a challenge especially during the dry season with the high cost of feeds.  He believes he will be able to consistently improve his farming business and build a strong foundation for the future education of his children.

Erick mentions low rains as the main challenge in farming and more specifically in the dairy farming business.

loans.use: buy barbed wire for a zero-grazing unit

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 40 years old and married with 2 children.  She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.   Milagros has been raising pigs for 8 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling livestock.

Milagros is borrowing PHP 24000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Matluba

texts.en:
Matluba is married and has 3 children. She always wanted to provide them with a good education, and since her husband died and her children became fatherless, she tries to do her best for them. 

After her husband died Matluba was in a depression and stopped her activities with clothing sales. Nowadays, as her income is not enough to provide her family with a good quality of life, Matluba decided to start her own business. She is going to be busy with selling different kind of fabrics. She wants to organize a profitable business, but her income is small and she is not able to do it. 

Matluba is asking for a loan of 3000 Somoni to buy fabrics.  In this way she will get through using her own assets and her business will continue to be a source of income so that her family can have a good quality of life and better financial opportunities to progress. She awaits your help.

loans.use: buy fabrics

loans.name: Nelvie

texts.en:
Nelvie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable retail business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 4 years and also earns more income from a general store and raising pigs.   Nelvie is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell for her vegetable retail business.  

Nelvie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of being able to repair and renovate her family home in the future and save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a beauty salon business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 20 years now.

Cecelia requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional equipment for her business.   In the future, Cecelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy beauty salon equipment

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 45 years old and married with 7 children.  She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines.  Gina has been raising livestock for 20 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Gina is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to raise.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy livestock

loans.name: Roger

texts.en: Roger, a 35-year-old single man who lives in the Philippines, has been providing habal-habal or motorcycle services for six years. Having joined HSPFI this year, he is requesting a loan for 4,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for the gasoline his service uses.  In the future, Roger hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is 38 years old from Nakuru and is married with two children who are aged between 12 years and six years old.

Ibrahim has a retail business that he has been doing for the past four years and has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy more sugar, cooking fat and rice to add to his stock for sale.

He hopes to see his business expand in the near future and be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking fat and rice for resale.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 48 years old. He is married to Lucy and together they have two children. He is a farmer and has been in the business for the past 11 years.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD. He was introduced to KADET by a credit officers. He will use the loan amount to plow his land for planting and purchase seedlings for planting on his farm

He hopes to expand his farming business by purchasing another piece of farming land.

loans.use: to plow the land for planting and purchase  planting seedlings

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Francisca, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen Asunta de Racsa” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. Nuestra socia se sigue dedicando al comercio de papas al por mayor y menor, trabajo que viene realizando hace años, el cual ha podido levantar y desarrollar para beneficio de su familia. Francisca provee de este tubérculo a diferentes mercados de la ciudad del cusco, mercado que ha sabido expandir gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo, Nuestra socia en esta oportunidad invertirá su préstamo para capitalizar su actividad y comprará diferentes especies de papas al por mayor, para cubrir su mercado y demanda.
Francisca está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla con la educación de sus hijos y por permitirle mantenerse con su actividad y llevar el sustento a su casa.
texts.en:
Meet Francisca: she is a member of the communal bank “Virgen Asunta de Racsa” and comes from the city of Cusco, Peru. For many years she has made a living by selling potatoes. She has managed to improve and develop her business, and her family has benefited from this. 

Francisca supplies potatoes at different markets around Cusco. Thanks to her hard work and efforts she has managed to expand her customer base. She plans to invest her loan in funding her business. She will buy different varieties of potatoes wholesale, in order to target her market niche and meet demand.

Francisca is very grateful to KIVA for helping her to educate her children and for allowing her to keep her business going and provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes wholesale.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 55 years old, married and a father of three school-going children. For the last eight years, he has earned a living from a retail business where he earns a monthly profit of KES 15,000.
 
He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our credit officers and is applying for his fourth loan of KES 60,000 which he will use to purchase additional stock of sugar, rice and flour for his retail shop business. He anticipates an increase in profits which he plans to reinvest back into the business.

In future he dreams of having a happy family and expanding his business further.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of sugar, rice and flour.

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es:
La señora Maximiliana tiene 50 años de edad, es madre y padre para su unico hijo, ella nació y vive en la ciudad de Oropesa a 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. Su actividad económica principal de la socia es la elaboración de pan. Ya son 15 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. 

La señora Maximiliana es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que le invitaron a participar del banco Comunal “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” de la Asociación Arariwa. En esta oportunidad la señora Maximiliana requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo sacos de azúcar, sacos de harina y otras cosas más. 

La señora Maximiliana agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Maximiliana is 50 years old and is mother and father to her only son.  She was born and lives in the city of Oropesa, located 30 minutes from the city of Cusco.  Her main financial activity is baking bread.  She has been in this business for 15 years and things are going well for her.

Maximiliana is a very enterprising and hardworking woman who was invited to participate in the Arariwa Association’s communal bank, “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa.”  On this occasion Ms. Maximiliana needs a loan to buy supplies, such as sacks of sugar, flower, and other things.

Maximiliana appreciates the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en: This time, Cresencia is borrowing PHP 25000 to purchase more grocery products to sell to her customers. The vegetables vending business that she previously funded through NWTF and KIVA continues to provide for Cresencia and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: buy grocery products to sell

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is a resident of the Likoni area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has three children; all of whom attend school. She owns a second-hand clothes shop, a business that she has been operating for thirteen years. The family also gets some income from the husband's employment. 

She learnt about Milango through an employee and joined the company with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenges are that some customers do not pay on time and that the clothes have high purchase prices. 

Jacqueline is applying for a loan of 31,450 Kenya shillings to purchase bales of second-hand clothes. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to pay school fees for her children. She aspires to start a transport business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase bales of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Antonieta Gladis

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Antonieta, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen Asunta de Racsa” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. Nuestra socia es una joven madre de una niña de 7 meses de nacida, que se dedica al comercio de vasijas, que son sacos de fibra de plástico para la contención de  papas, frutas y granos, Antonieta puso este negocio al ver la necesidad de sus compañeras de mercado que utilizan mucho estos sacos para comercializar sus productos, y además aprovecha para vender algunos otros productos como bebidas gaseosas, galletas, y golosinasEl sueño de Antonieta es verla crecer a su hija sin necesidades que en algún momento ella pasó, ofrecerle una buena educación y algún dia heredarle esta actividad que ella quiere hacer crecer y desarrollar.
Antonieta en esta oportunidad invertirá el préstamo solicitado para comprar sacos de fibra de plástico al por mayor y arpilleras para cumplir con su demanda y capitalizar su actividad. Antonieta está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y por ayudarla con el crecimiento y fortalecimiento de sus actividades.
texts.en:
Antonieta belongs to the “Virgen Asunta de Racsa” communal bank in the city of Cusco, Perú.  She’s a young mother of a seven-month-old daughter.  She sells containers consisting of plastic fiber sacks used to store potatoes, fruit and grains.  She started the business when she noticed that her fellow merchants in the market use these types of sacks very much to sell their products and she also takes advantage of the opportunity to sell other types of goods like soft-drinks, cookies and snacks.  Antonieta’s dream is to see her daughter grow without the privations she had to go through, offering her a good education and someday pass down to her this business that she wants to make grow and develop.

On this occasion, Antonieta will use the requested loan to buy plastic fiber sacks at wholesale and burlap to meet demand and capitalize her activity.  Antonieta is very grateful to KIVA for making it possible for her to give her family a better quality of life and helping her with the growth and strengthening of her business.

loans.use: to buy plastic fiber bags and burlap.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La señora Lucila tiene 41 años de edad, tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos, ella nació y vive en la ciudad de Oropesa a 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. Su actividad económica principal de la socia es la venta de productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo leche, fideos, aceite, harina, azúcar, arroz y otras cosas más.  

La señora Lucila es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que le invitaron a participar del banco Comunal “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” de la Asociación Arariwa. En esta oportunidad la señora Lucila requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo sacos de azúcar, sacos de fideos, detergentes, sacos de arroz y otras cosas más. 

La señora Lucila agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Lucila, 41, lives in a common law relationship and has four children.  She was born in and still lives in the city of Oropesa thirty minutes from the city of Cusco.  Her main economic activity is selling basic staples like milk, noodles, oil, flour, sugar, rice and other things.

Lucila is an enterprising, hardworking woman who was invited to participate in Asociación Arariwa’s “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” communal bank.  On this occasion Lucila needs the loan to buy merchandise like sacks of sugar, sacks of noodles, detergent, sacks of rice and other things.  She is grateful for the loan and commits to make her installment payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Bashir

texts.en:
Bashir is 31 years old. He and his wife Ericah are blessed with a two-month-old baby.  He owns a barber shop, a business he started 10 years ago, and in which he earns a monthly income of 17,000 Kenya shillings (KES).

He is requesting for his first loan of 20,000 KES to purchase two hair cutting machines. The profit he earns from his business will help him boost his wife's business. He dreams of owning a car someday.

loans.use: To purchase two hair cutting machines.

loans.name: Iwo Jima

texts.en:
Iwo Jima is 47 years old and married with one child.  Iwo Jima works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from food supplements retailing.

Iwo Jima requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.  She has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan.  She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 2 years.  Mary is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase materials for the repair of her fishing boat for her fishing business.

Mary has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to repair and renovate her family home in the future.

loans.use: repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Mylinda

texts.en:
Mylinda is 35 years old and married with 3 children.  She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.   Mylinda has been raising pigs for 16 years and also earns additional income from meat vending.

Mylinda is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Katia Diana

texts.es:
La señora Katia tiene 28 años de edad, es soltera, ella nació y vive en la ciudad de Oropesa a 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. Su actividad económica principal de la socia es la crianza de animales menores y también tiene una pequeña tienda de multi servicios. 

La señora Katia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que le invitaron a participar del banco Comunal “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” de la Asociación Arariwa. En esta oportunidad la señora Katia requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo sacos de azúcar, sacos de harina y animales menores como cuyes.  

La señora Katia agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Katia is 28 years old and she is single.  She was born and lives in the city of Oropesa, 30 minutes from the city of Cusco.  Her main business is raising small animals and she also has a small convenience store.

Katia is an enterprising and hardworking woman who was asked to join Asociación Arariwa's Virgen Asunta de Oropesa Communal Bank.  Katia currently needs a loan to buy supplies, such as sacks of sugar, sacks of flour, and small animals, such as guinea pigs. 

Katia is thankful for the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy supplies, such as sacks of sugar, sacks of flour, and small animals, such as guinea pigs.

loans.name: Ruchie

texts.en:
Ruchie is 23 years old and married with one child.  Ruchie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has been running the store for one year and also earns an income from food vending.

Ruchie has requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.  She has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Ruchie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 31 years old and married with six children.  Marites works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari sari store in the Philippines.  She has been running the store for 12 years and also earns an income from selling cucumbers.

Marites requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.  She has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Marites aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy items to sell in her store

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is 55 years old and married with 5 children. With 3 children in school, Sandra works very hard to provide for them.

Sandra runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, spices, canned goods, etc.

Sandra requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell for her general store.  In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Celsa  has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 8  years.   Celsa requested a loan for  PHP 4,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. 

Celsa  has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Sarom, 48, lives with her husband and five children, earning a living as fish seller. She and her husband has bought and sold fish for ten years. Out of her five children, she still has one daughter who is attending school while the others help support the family's business. 

This is the first loan for Sarom with Kiva's partner VisionFund. She is requesting this loan to use to buy more fish for resale and use a portion of it to plant some spices for her family as additional income. She hopes to increase her fish business so as to better her living conditions and keep her daughter in school.

loans.use: buy fish to sell

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines.   She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy more items like shampoo, laundry soap, and other grocery items to sell.

NWTF is relisting Cynthia's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future for her family.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Wilfredo Cristobal

texts.es:
Wilfredo, para aumentar la capacidad en el negocio solicita un nuevo préstamo e invertirlo en la compra de dos series de billetes de lotería, ya que de este negocio se ha logrado mantener por años, y siempre debe salir a ofrecer en la semana nuevas series de billete.

El mejoro la capacidad del negocio y al mismo tiempo ha recorrido nuevas zonas ofreciendo la lotería, esto le ha permitido atender bien a sus clientes y generar ingresos para su hogar.
texts.en:
In order to increase business capacity, Wilfredo needs a new loan to invest in the purchase of two series of lottery tickets because he’s supported himself by means of this business for years and he must go out offering new lottery series tickets weekly.  

He improved business capacity while at the same time going into new areas offering lottery tickets which has made it possible for him to provide good customer service and to generate household income.

loans.use: to buy two series of lottery numbers.

loans.name: Yuri Vanessa

texts.es:
Yuri, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo pues considera tener una mayor demanda y la necesidad para aumentar su capital de trabajo, se comprará maíz, leña, aceite, condimentos, que son necesarios para la preparación de alimentos, este préstamo ayudará para que yo continué trabajando.

Con el préstamo anterior logró mejorar la capacidad del negocio y atender un buen número de clientes, esto le ha dado la fortaleza para continuar trabajando por su familia y comenta que cuenta con un bebé de seis meses.
texts.en:
Yuri has decided on a new loan because she feels demand has grown and she needs to increase working capital.  She will buy corn, firewood, oil and condiments that are needed to prepare her dishes.  This loan will help her to stay in business.

With her previous loan she attained better business capacity and was able to tend to a good number of customers.  This has given her the strength to continue working for her family and she comments that she has a six-month-old baby.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, oil and condiments.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora  Angélica, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen Asunta de Racsa” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. Nuestra socia se sigue dedicando al comercio de papas al por mayor y menor, trabajo que viene realizando hace 15  años,  Angélica realiza este sacrificado  trabajo durante todo el día, desde muy temprano en la madrugada al momento de recibir la mercadería de los productores, hasta horas de la noche que termina el movimiento comercial. Angélica se sacrifica por su familia, para ofrecerle mejor educación a sus hijos, inversión que ella considera que es  lo más importante, y algún día no muy lejano poder comprar un camión para distribuir su mercadería.
 Nuestra socia en esta oportunidad invertirá su préstamo para capitalizar su actividad y comprará diferentes especies de papas al por mayor, para cubrir su mercado y demanda.
Angélica está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle mantenerse con su actividad, llevar el sustento a su casa y proporcionarles una mejor educación a sus hijos que es el gran sueño de Angelica, sacarlos profesionales , también espera que trabajando mucho y ahorrando, ella pueda adquirir un vehículo que le permita facilitar el transporte de sus productos.
texts.en:
This is our member, Angélica.  She belongs to the Virgen Asunta de Rasca Communal Bank from the city of Cusco, Peru.  She is still selling potatoes wholesale and retail, which she has been for 15 years.  Angélica does this demanding work all day long, from early in the morning when she gets her merchandise from her producers until nighttime when shopping traffic stops.  Angélica does everything she can for her family in order to offer her children  a better education, which she considers to be her most important investment.  Also, in the near future, she wants to be able to buy a truck to distribute her merchandise.

This time, our member will invest her loan in capitalizing her business and buying different kinds of potatoes wholesale to cover her market and her demand.

Angélica is very thankful to Kiva for allowing her to maintain her business, support her household, and offer her children a better education.  Angélica's greatest dream is to make her children professionals.  She also hopes that by working a lot and saving, she will be able to buy a vehicle so that she can transport her products more easily.

loans.use: to buy potatoes wholesale

loans.name: Tobias

texts.en:
Tobias is 36 years old. He is separated from the wife,but supports his two children aged 16 and two years. He is a tailor and has been in the business for the past six years.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. He will use the loan amount to purchase clothing material for use in his business.

He hopes to manage to bring back his wife back home.

loans.use: Purchase clothing material.

loans.name: Severiano

texts.es:
El señor Severiano tiene 49 años de edad, es viudo pero tiene cinco hijos, él nació y vive en la ciudad de Oropesa a 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. Su actividad económica principal del socio es la elaboración de panes pero en sus horas libres se dedica a brindar servicio de taxi. 

El señor Severiano es una hombre emprendedor y trabajador que le invitaron a participar del banco Comunal “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” de la Asociación Arariwa. En esta oportunidad el señor Severiano requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos para elaborar panes por lo tanto va comprar sacos de azúcar, sacos de harina y otras cosas más. 

El señor Severiano agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Severiano is 49 years old.  He is a widower, but he has five children.  He was born and lives in the city of Oropesa, 30 minutes from the city of Cusco.  Baking is his main business, but is offers taxi services in his free time.

Severiano is an enterprising and hardworking man who was asked to join Asociación Arariwa's Virgen Asunta de Oropesa Communal Bank.  This time, Severiano needs a loan to buy ingredients to make breads and so he will buy sacks of sugar, sacks of flour, and other things.

Severiano is thankful for the loan and he promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy sacks of sugar, sacks of flour, and other things

loans.name: Julia Rita

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “INTI QUILLA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Julia; La socia continua dedicandose a la compra y venta de artesanía y bisutería, la socia elabora lo que son muñecas artesanales,para luego venderlo a sus clientes que mas le solicitan mas que todo en el sector turismo,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual mediante este la socia saca adelante a su familia,la socia desea poder continuar trabajando por su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de materiales para la elaboracion de muñecas como telas de diferentes colores.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the "INTI QUILLA" communal bank, which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province and department. 

Julia still has a business buying and selling handicrafts and jewellery. She makes traditional dolls, which she then sells to her customers. The biggest demand for her dolls comes from the tourism sector. Julia has been in this business for some time now and it has allowed her to help her family get ahead. She would like to continue working for her family.

Julia is requesting this loan to purchase materials such as coloured fabric, for making her dolls.

She is pleased to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to purchase coloured fabric and other materials for making dolls.

loans.name: Yadis

texts.es:
En la tienda de Yadis, mujer de 32 años de edad, las amas de casa se reúnen, comparten su propia dinámica comunitaria  y compran diariamente productos de la canasta familiar,  en la cantidad que cada cual pueda pagar.  Yadis es madre de dos hijos en las edades de 9 y 15 años, que diariamente trabaja pensando justamente en su bienestar, por eso lo hace con mucho esmero e interés conservando así a su creciente clientela. 
Ella inició un negocio de tienda de ranchos, víveres, refrescos y abarrotes, hace dos años, entendiendo que debía trabajar para genera ingresos que beneficiaran su hogar, el cual solo estaba a cargo de su esposo y algunas veces no todo le salía bien  con los ingresos de su propio negocio, pues es también comerciante.  Con su tienda ha logrado ingresos para fortalecer el bienestar  de su familia y hoy  su sueño de prosperidad es ampliar su negocio, ofreciendo a su mercado todos los artículos por los cuales sus clientes preguntan y muchas veces su rotación rápida le impide responderles de manera inmediata, de igual manera vende pocos cárnicos pues no tiene una manera apropiada de refrigerarlos y tener un inventario. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará un congelador para hacer una buena refrigeración de carnes, pollo y pescado,  artículos que vende en pequeñas cantidades y quiere incrementar el volumen de sus ventas. Ella da “Gracias a Dios por abrir puertas con este negocio” y su meta a mediano plazo se concentra en comprar la vivienda donde tiene su negocio para continuar logrando bienestar para toda su familia.
texts.en:
Housewives gather together in Yadis’ store.  They share their own community dynamic and daily buy basic staple items in the amounts each can afford.
